commit_message:
Translate power state strings with dict for nodes.set_power_state().

Nova Ironic driver will call ironicclient to set the power state of an ironic
node. But the power state strings ironicclient could pass are different from
those defined in ironic_states. So we need to translate the ironic power
states to the strings required by ironicclient.

The original code made the translation hard coded in reboot()/power_on/()power_off(),
which did not use constants defined in ironic_states.py. This patch uses a dict
to improve the translation.

Change-Id: I6bd80479613791c24a7096f66d8be528cb2c7167
Implements: blueprint soft-reboot-poweroff
Related-to: blueprint enhance-power-interface-for-soft-reboot-and-nmi
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <chen.tang@easystack.cn>

DocImpact: This adds a new CONF option

Closes-Bug: #1543511
"}]
commit_message:
Fix instance delete stuck in deleting task_state

During instance deletion if rabbitmq-server crashes
after setting instance task_state to 'DELETING'. That
instance will get deleted only on nova-compute restart.

Added method to delete instances stuck in 'DELETING'
task_state without restarting nova compute service on
config reload.

DocImpact: This adds a new CONF option
'delete_instance_stuck_in_deleting_interval' to calculate
timeout, which in-turn is used to decide whether instance is
actually stuck in deleting task_state or the task_state is
set during normal delete request which is in-progress.

Change-Id: I879c442cd42349495db09237c8f28d693bb4c8c7
Closes-Bug: #1543511

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-09-27 07:13:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova/hacking/checks.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_hacking.py', 'HACKING.rst'], 'message': 'Prevent use filter(lambda ...) to meet python2,3

In python3 [1], if we need filter on python3, replace
filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with:
[obj for obj in data if test(obj)]. This patch introduces
a hacking rule to prevent using filter in future likes:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/362014/

Change-Id: Ia1a4dd4d3915ce5fd0c3bce371ffaafdfea3056e
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent use filter(lambda ...) to meet python2,3

In python3 [1], if we need filter on python3, replace
filter(lambda obj: test(obj), data) with:
[obj for obj in data if test(obj)]. This patch introduces
a hacking rule to prevent using filter in future likes:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/362014/

Change-Id: Ia1a4dd4d3915ce5fd0c3bce371ffaafdfea3056e

commit_message:
Add memory metric monitor

This patch adds a new monitor for the Nova metrics framework. This new
monitor collects memory-related information.

Change-Id: Ib0f857e972ee67b403268c561656b832c94b7e76
Partially-Implements: blueprint host-memory-metrics

commit_message:
Add get_host_memory_stats virt driver API

This patch adds the get_host_memory_stats virt driver API, which will
in turn be used to collect memory-related stats by the to-be-created
memory metric monitor. This patch also updates the fake virt driver
to return some static data for purposes of testing and the like.

Change-Id: I9c94ad0cfd4be91746a2909505f69e78b7267a55
Partially-Implements: blueprint host-memory-metrics

commit_message:
Add option to disable local disks in flavors [1/3]

This new feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create ephemeral disks on the hypervisor;
A new boolean field 'local_disks' is added to flavors.
If local_disks=False, users are "forced" to create
a bootable volume to launch an instance from that flavor.

This commit is the database/object related part of the
implementation.

Change-Id: I99bbf9b29100813609a62aa925600bc6bd4ba9c0
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none

commit_message:
Change disable_live_snapshot workaround

We are running in the gate with libvirt > 1.3 now, lets see if we can
do live_snapshot by default again.

The snapshot unit tests need to be effectively pinned to the non live
path, as they are tuned for the non live path, and the live path
requires different mocks.

Change-Id: I35fd40c2cf1d89c6ae23db2de5e20b3082f0e795

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-09-06 14:34:10.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_block_device.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/virt/block_device.py'], 'message': 'Reschedule boot when attach volume fails

Instance boots that fail during host side volume attachment are not
rescheduled to other hosts.  Host side volume attachment consists
of the get_volume_connector call to the virt driver and the
initialize_connection call to Cinder.  Either of these calls could
fail on host specific issues and could succeed if the instance were
rescheduled to another host.

these attachment methods fail and let this exception trigger a

Closes-Bug: #1488111
'}]
commit_message:
Reschedule boot when attach volume fails

Instance boots that fail during host side volume attachment are not
rescheduled to other hosts.  Host side volume attachment consists
of the get_volume_connector call to the virt driver and the
initialize_connection call to Cinder.  Either of these calls could
fail on host specific issues and could succeed if the instance were
rescheduled to another host.

The fix is to throw a new volume attachment exception if either of
these attachment methods fail and let this exception trigger a
reschedule instead of a BuildAbortException as is currently done.

Change-Id: I9600e2e2c3cb17228f5e44cf2699c44c18306aa4
Closes-Bug: #1488111

commit_message:
Optimize the function to use the right parameter

Function get_disk_size() has parameter but not use it,
it is strange for us.As rbd backend use rbd_name as
base image.So pass rbd_name to the get_disk_size() function.

Change-Id: I511780e2d72dbd491e28ad6e25a4d33e7e4c3bae

commit_message:
libvirt: fix detach volume race condition

When a volume is detached, the according share file is
detached if no longer used. This can cause issues if at the same
time, a different volume stored on the same share is being
attached as the according disk image will not be available.
This patch fixes the issue by tracking share usage.

Change-Id: I7b7ad794b1e15dcd63344e01a520d6c595a73d70
Closes-Bug: #1421550
Closes-Bug: #1461081

"min=0" is now introduced in oslo_config, so no

"block_device_allocate_retries".

start if negative value is specified for
"block_device_allocate_retries" parameter.

TrivialFix

'}]
commit_message:
Use min attribute from oslo_config

"min=0" is now introduced in oslo_config, so no
need to check for negative integer in code for
"block_device_allocate_retries".

start if negative value is specified for

commit_message:
Increase the possible size of the flavor extra_spec value

The maximum size of the flavor extra_spec value is 255 character [1],
but this is not always enough. There are cases where it is too small
so we need to increase (see: bug report)

[1] : https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/9c89e07/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api_models.py#L206

Change-Id: I79564032fe160421455a57fc2628b2f05d51b905
Closes-Bug: 1630463

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-20 17:40:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Evacuation of VM fails to plug on Destination

This evacuation problem can be reproduced with deployment of VM and
corresponding host is shut down immediately before VIF active state in
InstanceInfoCache is updated to True from False for corresponding VM.
By examining compute log on source Host, you can determine if
InstanceInfoCache has been updated to active=True or not.

When such a VM is evacuated to destination host, since vif state is not
active it goes into stale state and any attempt to plug goes nowhere.
This is due to communication is sent to wrong host (source instead of
destination).

This patchset fixes this problem by adding logic to rebuild_instance
method in compute manager. It sets active state of all VIFs in the VM
to true. This is how it will be if VIF state becomes active on source
host before it goes down.

All corresponding unit tests in test_compute and test_compute_mgr have
been updated.

Change-Id: Iba46e3eeeff622e700ad835c936c293fa057b55d
Closes-Bug: 1535918
'}]
commit_message:
Evacuation of VM fails to plug on Destination

This evacuation problem can be reproduced with deployment of VM and
corresponding host is shut down immediately before VIF active state in
InstanceInfoCache is updated to True from False for corresponding VM.
By examining compute log on source Host, you can determine if
InstanceInfoCache has been updated to active=True or not.

When such a VM is evacuated to destination host, since vif state is not
active it goes into stale state and any attempt to plug goes nowhere.
This is due to communication is sent to wrong host (source instead of
destination).

This patchset fixes this problem by adding logic to rebuild_instance
method in compute manager. It sets active state of all VIFs in the VM
to true. This is how it will be if VIF state becomes active on source
host before it goes down.

All corresponding unit tests in test_compute and test_compute_mgr have
been updated.

Change-Id: Iba46e3eeeff622e700ad835c936c293fa057b55d
Closes-Bug: 1535918

commit_message:
[POC][placement] Amend r-p/{uuid}/traits PUT to support os-traits

This patch amends /resource_providers/{uuid}/traits PUT to support
os-traits library. If the specified *custom* traits don't exist in the
placement database, it will return HTTP 400. And a 404 could happen if
the resource provider uuid is invalid.

Partial implement blueprint resource-provider-tags

Change-Id: I6ea5d247f5d279af50fd43ca7bab631321a81b92

commit_message:
[POC][placement] Amend traits modification api to support os-traits

This patch amends PUT '/traits' to allow admin users to modify only the
user-defined traits. Any attempts to put a standard trait will result in
HTTP 409.

This patch also amends DELETE '/traits' to allow admin users to delete
only the user-defined traits.

Partial implement blueprint resource-provider-tags

Change-Id: I1523174d4290bd8aef84d8c9447cd9199cbe128c

commit_message:
Make api-paste.ini part of python module

In part of the effort to make api-paste.ini code (rather than config)
lets move the ini file in to our python module. Also deprecate the
api_paste_config config option since it is no longer needed.

Change-Id: I83a10f9ccfcab2eb82c6844eddec5b56b49f278c

commit_message:
Remove block_migration from LM post operations

Right now information about migration type is stored in migrate_data
object, so we can remove block_migration argument from almost all
post live migration methods. However, we need to keep block_migration
argument in RPC for backward compatibility, but we can pass
migrate_data.block_migration instead of just block_migration.

Change-Id: Iba9f9963b94bd51de2fddf42532a3dd8e8ecf94f

commit_message:
Add the libvirt.ephemeral_image_format config option

This allows new ephemeral images to be optionally created
with type qcow2 rather than raw.

Wikimedia Labs has been running with this change hacked
into libvirt for many years.  It appears that there
is some interest from other users, as per
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2015-October/008520.html

Change-Id: Ie9e97dccb96c9ff6b82df2dc698db23056a9cc79

commit_message:
Update references for split up hardware module

The hardware module has been split. Let's update the references,
renaming any functions to remove duplication of module names.

Change-Id: Iaffad530dc1da8357a2b3f618cac7dcac0233b1b

commit_message:
Remove block_migration argument from live migration operations

Because block_migration is not used during the live migration operations,
we can safely mark it as deprecated.

Change-Id: I9276a6c00e7b4ec9d287fe94473d62122eb69141

commit_message:
Add support for detaching interfaces in ironic

This change implements support for detaching specified interface of
baremetal node.
For proper detach, interface should be unplugged by ironic.
Also uplug required for deleting port from neutron.

Partial-bug: 1609097
Change-Id: I1cd6cac590392c6f813fd5679f9e0f254b735ee5

commit_message:
WIP: api: discoverable policy

Adds validation schemas for several API actions.

Adds os-endpoints API Controller. Returns API endpoints
and their schema validations based on the request's
API microversion.

Implements: blueprint discoverable-api-endpoints

Change-Id: I9afb58787036b4fbdfd1208722c273c8bd95eb44

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-12 13:02:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/compute.py', 'releasenotes/notes/mutable-config-ocata-7fddd2255bdfb229.yaml', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'Mutable compute options: reserves, ratios

Make these options mutable:

    DEFAULT/reserved_host_disk_mb
    DEFAULT/reserved_host_memory_mb
    DEFAULT/cpu_allocation_ratio
    DEFAULT/ram_allocation_ratio
    DEFAULT/disk_allocation_ratio

The reservations present no difficulty. The ratios are copied about a
bit, I am not concerned about the HostState objects as these are
transient. I think the usages by cells and NUMATopologyLimits are also
OK.

bp mutable-config-ocata

Change-Id: I1011a28bfc0d3021acd8fc889c0d74f5fe2a8068
'}]
commit_message:
Mutable compute options: reserves, ratios

Make these options mutable:

    DEFAULT/reserved_host_disk_mb
    DEFAULT/reserved_host_memory_mb
    DEFAULT/cpu_allocation_ratio
    DEFAULT/ram_allocation_ratio
    DEFAULT/disk_allocation_ratio

The reservations present no difficulty. The ratios are copied about a
bit, I am not concerned about the HostState objects as these are
transient. I think the usages by cells and NUMATopologyLimits are also
OK.

bp mutable-config-ocata

Change-Id: I1011a28bfc0d3021acd8fc889c0d74f5fe2a8068

The 'hardware' file is currently a bit of catch-all:

* NUMA CPU and hugepage calculation utilities
* General CPU calculation utilities
* Serial port utilities
* Wrappers to handle hosts that don't pass objects over RPC
* Some other stuff...

Rather than mixing all this functionality together, the code should be
modularized. As such, split this file and dependendent tests into
separate modules. Imports are included in __init__ to prevent the
need to big-bang covert all the callers in the same change.

Change-Id: I617e1168e115dda92658b107ee54795ab7d14e0b

commit_message:
hardware: Split into modules

The 'hardware' file is currently a bit of catch-all:

* NUMA CPU and hugepage calculation utilities
* General CPU calculation utilities
* Serial port utilities
* Wrappers to handle hosts that don't pass objects over RPC
* Some other stuff...

Rather than mixing all this functionality together, the code should be
modularized. As such, split this file and dependendent tests into
separate modules. Imports are included in __init__ to prevent the
need to big-bang covert all the callers in the same change.

Change-Id: I617e1168e115dda92658b107ee54795ab7d14e0b

subject: Using assertIsNone() instead of assertIs(None, ..)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-22 11:20:50.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py'], 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertIs(None, ..)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..,None)

Change-Id: I051dff5e7b940ea36800952f7a82c7e9c2348866
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertIs(None, ..)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..,None)

Change-Id: I051dff5e7b940ea36800952f7a82c7e9c2348866

This patch allows multiple Neutron port ids to be mapped to a single
Ironic port or portgroup by changing the vif_port_id field into a list
called vif_port_ids, and updates the network providers and dhcp plugins
to understand the new format. This is the Nova part of enabling
VLAN aware Baremetal instances.

Change-Id: I7111821f48de635821b3a5ae898a7c1c0650c6dd
Related-Bug: #1543584
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Allow mapping multiple Neutron ports to Ironic ports

This patch allows multiple Neutron port ids to be mapped to a single
Ironic port or portgroup by changing the vif_port_id field into a list
called vif_port_ids, and updates the network providers and dhcp plugins
to understand the new format. This is the Nova part of enabling
VLAN aware Baremetal instances.

Change-Id: I7111821f48de635821b3a5ae898a7c1c0650c6dd
Related-Bug: #1543584

commit_message:
Extract duplicated code from compute manager

(nova/compute/manager.py)
In the _do_build_and_run_instance method the exceptions are treated in
the very similar way, when a _build_and_run_instance call fails. So
I extracted these clean up calls into a new method. I did it based on
the following link (159~CloneClass):
http://openqa.sed.hu/sourcemeter_duplications/load_duplications_page?data_key=OpenStack:nova:nova/compute/manager.py
I also added unit test to the new method

Change-Id: I41f12800082243118747417f01dab8063fc47742

subject: driver-teams: add resolution requiring teams to accept driver contributions
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-28 17:53:35.000000000', 'files': ['resolutions/20161128-driver-teams.rst'], 'message': 'driver-teams: add resolution requiring teams to accept driver contributions

The OpenStack community wants to encourage collaboration between
vendors. The best way to do this, while maintaining a level playing
field for all contributors, is to require teams that provide driver
interfaces to accept contributions of drivers written to those
interfaces.

Change-Id: I56c075b6f758c12c660a7ea2f1933e8194db0782
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
driver-teams: add resolution requiring teams to accept driver contributions

The OpenStack community wants to encourage collaboration between
vendors. The best way to do this, while maintaining a level playing
field for all contributors, is to require teams that provide driver
interfaces to accept contributions of drivers written to those
interfaces.

Change-Id: I56c075b6f758c12c660a7ea2f1933e8194db0782
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: driver-teams: Stop requiring a level playing field
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 18:12:08.000000000', 'files': ['reference/new-projects-requirements.rst', 'resolutions/20161128-driver-teams.rst'], 'message': 'driver-teams: Stop requiring a level playing field

Acknowledge our expectation for a level playing field but resolve
that it is not necessary to require one, and that attempting to do
so inhibits tighter integration of driver development for
proprietary systems with the rest of the community. Remove this
principle as a strict requirement.

Change-Id: Ia31336419e37397d90f52ccaced239f0e3c3d8f4
'}]
commit_message:
driver-teams: Stop requiring a level playing field

Acknowledge our expectation for a level playing field but resolve
that it is not necessary to require one, and that attempting to do
so inhibits tighter integration of driver development for
proprietary systems with the rest of the community. Remove this
principle as a strict requirement.

Change-Id: Ia31336419e37397d90f52ccaced239f0e3c3d8f4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 18:06:42.000000000', 'files': ['resolutions/20161128-driver-teams.rst'], 'message': 'driver-teams: Proprietary driver dev is unlevel

Reaffirm that OpenStack is about enabling open collaboration and our
dedication to maintaining a level playing field. Resolve that
development of drivers for proprietary systems, while important, is
incompatible with this principle and so those developers focused
solely on drivers will not be recognized as official teams by the
OpenStack technical committee.

Change-Id: I632f574bbd2321980765489fcd9c72df1422581c
'}]
commit_message:
driver-teams: Proprietary driver dev is unlevel

Reaffirm that OpenStack is about enabling open collaboration and our
dedication to maintaining a level playing field. Resolve that
development of drivers for proprietary systems, while important, is
incompatible with this principle and so those developers focused
solely on drivers will not be recognized as official teams by the
OpenStack technical committee.

Change-Id: I632f574bbd2321980765489fcd9c72df1422581c

subject: Resolve systemd trusty issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 19:30:17.000000000', 'files': ['vars/ubuntu-14.04.yml'], 'message': 'Resolve systemd trusty issue

Ansible fails to detect upstart properly on trusty systems where
systemd is running, due to the existence of /run/systemd/system.

As shown in the testing here: http://cdn.pasteraw.com/l0ua0oxpnyu4qjwuztg59grbyqp3tqx
installing the systemd-shim package disables systemd and removes
/run/systemd/system, preventing this issue.

Change-Id: I6a535181c85a0f89cfbfb812051f65eb5ce8e3d4
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve systemd trusty issue

Ansible fails to detect upstart properly on trusty systems where
systemd is running, due to the existence of /run/systemd/system.

As shown in the testing here: http://cdn.pasteraw.com/l0ua0oxpnyu4qjwuztg59grbyqp3tqx
installing the systemd-shim package disables systemd and removes
/run/systemd/system, preventing this issue.

Change-Id: I6a535181c85a0f89cfbfb812051f65eb5ce8e3d4

commit_message:
Consistently use a exception vs sys.exit

This also makes it so that the config check
accumulates errors instead of bailing out
immediatly (using a sys.exit) which seems nicer
than blowing up on the first error.

Change-Id: I915ef5a018969eee87ac1ab3ddc88fc1b89a3448

commit_message:
Add ability to output the things built/failed/not build

Instead of having users of kolla image building grep the
output of kolla (or grep `docker images` before and after
kolla is ran) to find what was actually built have kolla
be able to write exactly what was built (thus avoiding the
whole docker and grep stuff).

Closes-Bug: #1640973

Change-Id: I11c031b4ded2ff780fa3ceb809a2ee232b36100c

commit_message:
Fix can't generate heka-custom.toml on multi-nodes

Original we judge heka-custom.toml whether exists with stat: path=
method, but if deploy on multi-nodes, should add local_action.

Closes-Bug: #1646732

commit_message:
Swift data transfer should not be using the API Network

The account, container, and object templates were incorrectly
using the api_interface as their bind_ip configuration setting.

Updated these templates to instead use the storage_interface.

Change-Id: I683102096cd6aa3c77a7900f5a1a248cdcddba42
Note: Rings must be generated accordingly.

commit_message:
Remove type field and type description for create volume from a snapshot

The new volume should have the same type as the snapshot that the volume
is created from. Setting a different type will get an error from the API.

This behavior should be the same when creating a volume from the Volumes
tab and the Volume Snapshots tab.

Closes-bug: #1582458

Change-Id: I0443eb5c6cb18538ff76fc49d4018221691a2ea2

subject: Make RPCFixture support multiple connections
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16897, 'name': 'Virtuozzo Storage CI', 'email': 'vzstorage-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'vzstorage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 23, 'created': '2016-12-07 14:47:46.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'nova/tests/fixtures.py', 'nova/rpc.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_rpc.py'], 'message': "Make RPCFixture support multiple connections

For testing cells, we will need to track the driver instances that
we give out by url. This normally just works with a conventional
oslo.messaging driver, but the fake driver keeps internal data
structures for simulating its bus. If we end up with clients creating
a new instance of the driver in the rpc switching code, we'll never
be able to send messages to services because we'll always have
private/separate data structures.

So, this makes the fixture wrap the transport creation stuff
and unify references by url. In order to make this work, some
retooling of rpc.init() is done, which makes it more in line with
the recent additions we had for wrapping transport initialization
per connection anyway.

For now, a lot of our tests can't handle the possibility of
multiple RPC connections due to them looking at the global
transport_url configuration. So for the moment, even though this
makes the fixture support multiple independent connections, we
collapse any such attempts down to a single connection to the
default broker.

Note: this requires a fix in oslo.messaging 5.14.0

Depends-On: I01b6f5a20ea9752da46a546a908bd38cf11da681
Change-Id: Icb63d7dabd17f3c5633387793f68a8ba20863a7e
"}]
commit_message:
Make RPCFixture support multiple connections

For testing cells, we will need to track the driver instances that
we give out by url. This normally just works with a conventional
oslo.messaging driver, but the fake driver keeps internal data
structures for simulating its bus. If we end up with clients creating
a new instance of the driver in the rpc switching code, we'll never
be able to send messages to services because we'll always have
private/separate data structures.

So, this makes the fixture wrap the transport creation stuff
and unify references by url. In order to make this work, some
retooling of rpc.init() is done, which makes it more in line with
the recent additions we had for wrapping transport initialization
per connection anyway.

For now, a lot of our tests can't handle the possibility of
multiple RPC connections due to them looking at the global
transport_url configuration. So for the moment, even though this
makes the fixture support multiple independent connections, we
collapse any such attempts down to a single connection to the
default broker.

Note: this requires a fix in oslo.messaging 5.14.0

Depends-On: I01b6f5a20ea9752da46a546a908bd38cf11da681
Change-Id: Icb63d7dabd17f3c5633387793f68a8ba20863a7e

commit_message:
Fix pci_alias that include white spaces

When the PCI alias was getting translated to a PCI request,
all the white spaces were getting removed. So the pci_passthrough:alias
specified in the flavor never matched the device in pci_alias.
This patch fixes the bug by only stripping the white spaces
at the beginning or the end of the elements

Conflicts:
  nova/tests/unit/pci/test_request.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Test conflict caused by the reorganisation of PCI options
as part of I886045ab4e6bdb8418fd1ccdcd811417ecb4ad4a.

Change-Id: I2888b03faf6c25bcb6011db40100d925972c2231
Closes-Bug: #1638200
(cherry picked from commit 9b88e755d93200811487d2f778735869f8fe07af)

subject: Handle MarkerNotFound from cell0 database
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 01:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Handle MarkerNotFound from cell0 database

When listing instances in the cellv2 world we look them up
from three locations:

1. Build requests which exist before the instances are created
   in the cell database (after the scheduler picks a host to
   build the instance). Currently instances and build requests
   are both created before casting to conductor, but that's going
   away in Ocata with the support for multiple cellsv2 cells.
2. The cell0 database for instances which failed to get scheduled
   to a compute host (and therefore a cell).
3. The actual cell database that the instance lives in. Currently
   that's only a single traditional nova database, but could be one
   of multiple cellsv2 cells when we add that support in Ocata.

If a marker is passed in when listing instances, if the instance
lives in an actual cell database, we'll get a MarkerNotFound failure
from cell0 because the instance doesn't exist in cell0, but we check
cell0 before we check the cell database. This makes the instance
listing short-circuit and fail with a 400 from the REST API.

This patch simply handles the MarkerNotFound when listing instances
from the cell0 database and ignores it so we can continue onto the
cell database.

Closes-Bug: #1647464

Change-Id: I977497be262fb7f2333e32fb7313b29624323422
(cherry picked from commit 72d28ccd6e8ce8cf700891788f06578313b03c38)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle MarkerNotFound from cell0 database

When listing instances in the cellv2 world we look them up
from three locations:

1. Build requests which exist before the instances are created
   in the cell database (after the scheduler picks a host to
   build the instance). Currently instances and build requests
   are both created before casting to conductor, but that's going
   away in Ocata with the support for multiple cellsv2 cells.
2. The cell0 database for instances which failed to get scheduled
   to a compute host (and therefore a cell).
3. The actual cell database that the instance lives in. Currently
   that's only a single traditional nova database, but could be one
   of multiple cellsv2 cells when we add that support in Ocata.

If a marker is passed in when listing instances, if the instance
lives in an actual cell database, we'll get a MarkerNotFound failure
from cell0 because the instance doesn't exist in cell0, but we check
cell0 before we check the cell database. This makes the instance
listing short-circuit and fail with a 400 from the REST API.

This patch simply handles the MarkerNotFound when listing instances
from the cell0 database and ignores it so we can continue onto the
cell database.

Closes-Bug: #1647464

Change-Id: I977497be262fb7f2333e32fb7313b29624323422
(cherry picked from commit 72d28ccd6e8ce8cf700891788f06578313b03c38)

commit_message:
Using get() method to prevent KeyError

Using get() to access keys like "summary.guest.toolsStatus" and
"summary.guest.toolrunningStatus" to avoid exception during hard reboot.
This change would use a default values even if they don't exist in dict
as we can have VMs where VM tools wouldn't be installed/running which leads
to hard reboot

Change-Id: I332867fe783d6d47b81d8a53153af140d4158217
Closes-bug: #1563325
(cherry picked from commit d3c7396d87681b82327c59c27fe14cf5e20c3ba5)

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/9a0f7bcf2ea57d7c87651330c4a18ec1\n'

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 05:24:11.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_security_services.py', 'manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_share_networks.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ic68ba358d51002e1a1aeac6159248ffb730b5daf
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ic68ba358d51002e1a1aeac6159248ffb730b5daf

commit_message:
Update "Add community-level image sharing' spec

This patch updates the spec so that it accurately reflects the
implementation.  In particular, it adds justification for making
'shared' the default image visibility and provides more discussion
of end user impact.

subject: Use project_domain_id only in password auth
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 02:36:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/common/client_config.py'], 'message': 'Use project_domain_id only in password auth

The method being changed constructs domain-related parameters that will
further be passed to the auth plugin. If project domain is not
passed, the method sets it to the default domain.

token_endpoint does not expect any information about domain,
because it uses only a token and URL. Passing it to auth plugin causes
an exception.

Construct domain-related parameters only for specific plugins, such
as password or totp.

Change-Id: I13db3bbe31a0ed843e9f4528d37c768546e2bee9
Closes-Bug: 1642301
(cherry picked from commit e51a8d63747932f2ee4ffab02dfb0cd43e4a103d)
'}]
commit_message:
Use project_domain_id only in password auth

The method being changed constructs domain-related parameters that will
further be passed to the auth plugin. If project domain is not
passed, the method sets it to the default domain.

token_endpoint does not expect any information about domain,
because it uses only a token and URL. Passing it to auth plugin causes
an exception.

Construct domain-related parameters only for specific plugins, such
as password or totp.

Change-Id: I13db3bbe31a0ed843e9f4528d37c768546e2bee9
Closes-Bug: 1642301
(cherry picked from commit e51a8d63747932f2ee4ffab02dfb0cd43e4a103d)

subject: Mask passwords in debug logs for auth_config_hook
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 8410, 'name': 'Richard Theis', 'email': 'rtheis@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'rtheis'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 14937, 'name': 'Tang Chen', 'email': 'imtangchen@163.com', 'username': 'tangchen'}, {'_account_id': 23303, 'name': 'howardlee', 'email': 'lihongweibj@inspur.com', 'username': 'howardlee'}, {'_account_id': 23314, 'name': 'lidong', 'email': 'lidongbj@inspur.com', 'username': 'lidong'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-06 20:12:27.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/common/client_config.py'], 'message': "Mask passwords in debug logs for auth_config_hook

The auth config hook can have credentials in it so
we have to mask the config before logging it. To
avoid doing the work of masking the password if we
aren't going to log it, there is a conditional put
around the actual debug statement.

Conflicts:
        openstackclient/common/client_config.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict was due to imports.

Change-Id: I8e626672ec94fc837610216bccb4354dbdedca17
Closes-Bug: #1630822
(cherry picked from commit cd1a412408f068aeef97c1ee368400307fce7733)
"}]
commit_message:
Mask passwords in debug logs for auth_config_hook

The auth config hook can have credentials in it so
we have to mask the config before logging it. To
avoid doing the work of masking the password if we
aren't going to log it, there is a conditional put
around the actual debug statement.

Conflicts:
        openstackclient/common/client_config.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict was due to imports.

Change-Id: I8e626672ec94fc837610216bccb4354dbdedca17
Closes-Bug: #1630822
(cherry picked from commit cd1a412408f068aeef97c1ee368400307fce7733)

commit_message:
Set noop dhcp provider for ironicclient func tests

This environment doesn't have devstack, don't use neutron as a DHCP
provider. We don't actually DHCP in this environment, but the noop
network interface isn't compatible with it.

subject: [AMQP 1.0] Simplify the I/O event loop code
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 8770, 'name': 'Ken Giusti', 'email': 'kgiusti@gmail.com', 'username': 'kgiusti'}, {'_account_id': 9257, 'name': 'John Eckersberg', 'email': 'jeckersb@redhat.com', 'username': 'jeckersb'}, {'_account_id': 13290, 'name': 'Oleksii Zamiatin', 'email': 'ozamiatin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ozamiatin'}, {'_account_id': 20523, 'name': 'Andy Smith', 'email': 'ansmith@redhat.com', 'username': 'ajssmith'}, {'_account_id': 20864, 'name': 'Gevorg Davoian', 'email': 'gdavoian@gmail.com', 'username': 'gdavoian'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-06 00:54:10.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp1_driver/eventloop.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp1_driver/controller.py'], 'message': "[AMQP 1.0] Simplify the I/O event loop code

Leverage the fact that there is never more than one socket active to
simplify the event loop's I/O processing.  This removes the need to
look up active connections.  Also removes the need to query the return
values from select since there is only one socket to process. This
change improves RPC throughput under the simulator by up to 20%

As part of this change I've clarified the code's use of the pyngus
connection by renaming the connection property to something a bit more
specific.

Change-Id: If7c020bb0bd96490af78bc06659db10073b02417
"}]
commit_message:
[AMQP 1.0] Simplify the I/O event loop code

Leverage the fact that there is never more than one socket active to
simplify the event loop's I/O processing.  This removes the need to
look up active connections.  Also removes the need to query the return
values from select since there is only one socket to process. This
change improves RPC throughput under the simulator by up to 20%

As part of this change I've clarified the code's use of the pyngus
connection by renaming the connection property to something a bit more
specific.

Change-Id: If7c020bb0bd96490af78bc06659db10073b02417

commit_message:

One of the rest driver unit tests was not mocking out the requests
module causing it to attempt to make https get requests.
This patch corrects that oversight.

commit_message:
Add the enable_new_services option to nova::compute

Make sure we can set the enable_new_services config
option on the nova compute nodes since it's used to
determine if it should register itself in the database
the first time the service is started.

commit_message:
networking-midonet: Add "full" variants for ml2 and v2 jobs

At this point, they are identical with the non-full variants,
except that the new ones are master only and non-voting.

The plan is to make the existing voting jobs minimum later.
(eg. No advanced services)

Partial-Bug: #1615668
Change-Id: I7951c0f9a5c82dae42ba774f210d21e52dac01c7

commit_message:
Remove pxe_ssh, agent_ssh drivers in docs and devstack

This patch removes pxe_ssh, agent_ssh in dev-quickstart and
ironic-multitenant-networking documents because drivers will be
removed in Ocata cycle or later [1].

[1]http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ironic/newton.html#deprecation-notes

Change-Id: I2537f44f6b9ca09f756e1f624cc3ce6266f4dbd8

commit_message:
Add requirement for cross-process cache

Some of the trove-dashboard panels require a cross-process cache
to be used to temporarily store data until it is committed to the
server.  For example, building up the list of configuration
parameters is store in the cache until it is applied to the the
database instance.

This requirement is now added to the readme to inform users to
enable the cache.

Change-Id: I1928da600c7364d8681a8c0b45fe1c66c97032df
Closes-Bug: #1638713

subject: Fix default IPv6 BGP peer for BIRD
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 21:34:49.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/neutron_calico_dhcp_agent.yml'], 'message': 'Fix default IPv6 BGP peer for BIRD

The jinja calculation of the BIRD BGP peer was failing intermittently
when IPv6 connectivity was not present.

Even though the IPv6 deployment was being detected correctly as
disabled by the role, the configuration task was failing to skip
consistently because the IPv6 peer address var could not be
resolved by Jinja.

This fixes the default IPv6 peer calculation to resolve to an empty
string when no IPv6 connectivity is present, which allows the
automatic IPv6 detection to skip the config task.

Change-Id: If450b237ba349a163f44f40b945c98b14c9d7042
'}]
commit_message:
Fix default IPv6 BGP peer for BIRD

The jinja calculation of the BIRD BGP peer was failing intermittently
when IPv6 connectivity was not present.

Even though the IPv6 deployment was being detected correctly as
disabled by the role, the configuration task was failing to skip
consistently because the IPv6 peer address var could not be
resolved by Jinja.

This fixes the default IPv6 peer calculation to resolve to an empty
string when no IPv6 connectivity is present, which allows the
automatic IPv6 detection to skip the config task.

Change-Id: If450b237ba349a163f44f40b945c98b14c9d7042

subject: TrivialFix: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 09:03:40.000000000', 'files': ['zun/db/etcd/api.py', 'zun/db/etcd/models.py'], 'message': 'TrivialFix: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I2a201cce19b66d61924738fb89ded7e265b780ec
'}]
commit_message:
TrivialFix: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I2a201cce19b66d61924738fb89ded7e265b780ec

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 15:03:01.000000000', 'files': ['files/monasca_stack.sh'], 'message': "Fix a couple bugs in the stack management script

There are two use cases for a stack restart,
one where you want to take a node down for maintentance,
and two where you really want to stop the whole monasca
stack.  monasca-thresh is a cluster-wide process and can
be stopped from any node in the cluster.  But stopping it
when taking a single node out of service isn't appropriate.

Also update the lag checks for the new/correct way to
get kafka consumer lag.

Change-Id: I333b791c903a45e8a0fc101ade229991a03da2cc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a couple bugs in the stack management script

There are two use cases for a stack restart,
one where you want to take a node down for maintentance,
and two where you really want to stop the whole monasca
stack.  monasca-thresh is a cluster-wide process and can
be stopped from any node in the cluster.  But stopping it
when taking a single node out of service isn't appropriate.

Also update the lag checks for the new/correct way to
get kafka consumer lag.

Change-Id: I333b791c903a45e8a0fc101ade229991a03da2cc

subject: Change initrd extraction method for partition undercloud
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-09 15:04:11.000000000', 'files': ['roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Change initrd extraction method for partition undercloud

There is a strange issue with the new image building process in
RDO where the host initramfs is ending up in the undercloud.qcow2,
but the host kernel is not. This initramfs does not match the
kernel from the CentOS cloud image used as a base, but instead is
for a newer kernel. The virt-get-kernel command just takes the
newest kernel and initramfs it can find in /boot/, which in this
case ends up with a mismatch.

Since the new image building process is just a converted
overcloud-full image, we can just copy-out the DIB extracted kernel
and initramfs from the undercloud to use for booting it. DIB seems
to be a bit smarter about how it extracts the kernel and initramfs,
so we do not get the same mismatch.

Change-Id: I66f6f168417377f313c003be70ee708310371f35
'}]
commit_message:
Change initrd extraction method for partition undercloud

There is a strange issue with the new image building process in
RDO where the host initramfs is ending up in the undercloud.qcow2,
but the host kernel is not. This initramfs does not match the
kernel from the CentOS cloud image used as a base, but instead is
for a newer kernel. The virt-get-kernel command just takes the
newest kernel and initramfs it can find in /boot/, which in this
case ends up with a mismatch.

Since the new image building process is just a converted
overcloud-full image, we can just copy-out the DIB extracted kernel
and initramfs from the undercloud to use for booting it. DIB seems
to be a bit smarter about how it extracts the kernel and initramfs,
so we do not get the same mismatch.

Change-Id: I66f6f168417377f313c003be70ee708310371f35

commit_message:

Test env requests are queuing up and nothing is getting a env in a timely
mannor. As I think we are still trying to create envs for jobs that have
timed out. Revert this to our behaviour befor last week while we investigate
the problem.

Change-Id: I79353941d838628e492b46acce6dde8ef2ec3aff

commit_message:
Add flag to enable the SECURE_PROXY_SSL_HEADER option

This is used to tell Django to take into account the X-Forwarded-Proto
header. It is disabled by default as it should only be enabled if one
is running horizon behind a proxy.

Change-Id: Ifed7d4c3409419c01c5b20c707221c1fc76ea09e

subject: Enable ironic tempest plugin in grenade job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 12:29:42.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ironic.yaml'], 'message': "Enable ironic tempest plugin in grenade job

Now that tempest's CONF.service_available.ironic has moved to the
plugin, we need to ensure the plugin is enabled when running grenade.
Refactor the plugin to its own builder, make the grenade builder use
ironic-extra-vars, and add the builder to any jobs currently using
devstack-virtual-ironic.

Change-Id: I02d49dca423b9b09d049f1ca1d5e2887dbbda228
Related-Bug: #1614516
"}]
commit_message:
Enable ironic tempest plugin in grenade job

Now that tempest's CONF.service_available.ironic has moved to the
plugin, we need to ensure the plugin is enabled when running grenade.
Refactor the plugin to its own builder, make the grenade builder use
ironic-extra-vars, and add the builder to any jobs currently using
devstack-virtual-ironic.

Change-Id: I02d49dca423b9b09d049f1ca1d5e2887dbbda228
Related-Bug: #1614516

commit_message:
Move 'parse_bool_param' to api common

The 'parse_bool_param' function is now only used at API layer, we can
move it there. The side effect is that we can directly raise webob.exc
HTTPBadRequest.

Change-Id: I3725505c9f6ebe05eaa50147b7ad5de40d434641

commit_message:
Update renamed repos in .gitmodules

The ceilometer-specs repo was renamed to telemetry-specs, and
python-keystoneclient-federation was renamed to
python-keystoneclient-saml2 and then later renamed again to
keystoneauth-saml2. Reflect this correctly in the .gitmodules file.

Change-Id: I430dc42b1957a028b67e09580c5ad1907686c99c

subject: Make sure opportunistic DB use in unit tests works
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-07 21:41:54.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Make sure opportunistic DB use in unit tests works

Many of our projects were only being tested against unit test
environments with databases preconfigured, which is hidden arcane
setup knowledge in many cases. Make sure that projects also get a
base run against non-"db" versions of unit test jobs so that
opportunistic DB detection in unit tests doesn't bitrot, in support
of the Consistent Testing Interface.

Change-Id: I65d471fdbc00064c75140942840e242d5e7c1064
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure opportunistic DB use in unit tests works

Many of our projects were only being tested against unit test
environments with databases preconfigured, which is hidden arcane
setup knowledge in many cases. Make sure that projects also get a
base run against non-"db" versions of unit test jobs so that
opportunistic DB detection in unit tests doesn't bitrot, in support
of the Consistent Testing Interface.

Change-Id: I65d471fdbc00064c75140942840e242d5e7c1064

commit_message:
filter : strictly isolate group of hosts for an image

  * Adds a global option `aggregate_image_filter_strict_isolation`
which dictates strictness level of isolation.

  * Adds custom_properties in ImageMeta.

Implements: Strictly isolate group of hosts for an image
Change-Id: Ic03f0707df0ad402e5eb32035baf625eef23c8fa

commit_message:
Source the openrc file automatically when running tools/init-runonce

When run tools/init-runonce without Keystone credentials specified,
it will source the openrc file automatically.

TrivialFix

commit_message:
Add migrations for NICs and Bonds 'interface_properties'

* Add default bond_attributes and nic_attributes for upgrade 'releases' table
* Add upgrade and downgrade migrations for NICs from 'interface_properties'
  into 'attributes' and 'meta' fields and contrary.
* Add upgrade and downgrade migrations for Bonds from 'interface_properties'
  and 'bond_properties' fields into 'attributes' field and contrary.

Change-Id: Ib1b1ad55372fa1e7e67a51273ce237acb61a7201
Implements: blueprint nics-and-nodes-attributes-via-plugin

commit_message:
Replace uuid4() with uuidsentinel

As of now, in most of the test cases, uuidsentinel is used for
generating a UUID except at some places where uuid4() is used.
In order to maintain consistency, we propose to use uuidsentinel
module for generating UUIDs throughout the test cases.

There are some cases where unique UUIDs are required. For such
cases, generate_uuid() from oslo_utils.uuidutils is used.

Change-Id: Ifaee2f79fc33d189751c4e3f405b579dd8d89784

commit_message:
objects: Removes base code that already exists in o.vo

Removes code that already exists in the minimum required version
of oslo.versionedobjects.

Removes NovaObject obj_reset_changes method.
Removes NovaObjectDictCompat __iter__ and keys methods.
Removes obj_make_list function.
Removes test_obj_reset_changes_recursive unit test.
Removes test_obj_make_list unit test.

subject: Fixes AttributError thrown by utils.CustomUnpickler.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-06 15:09:30.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes AttributError thrown by utils.CustomUnpickler.

This bug only affects environments in which cPickle is
unavailable (such as Python 3.4).

Attribute error is thrown by CustomUnpickler in
muranodashboard.common.utils.CustomUnpickler.__init__,
when unpickler.noload is referenced.

From the pickle documentation
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/pickle.html):
"Note: the noload() method is currently only available on
Unpickler objects created with the cPickle module. pickle module
Unpicklers do not have the noload() method."

Change-Id: I16161ce27bca7185c02b21ee9c9db2536ec437ca
Closes-Bug: #1647490
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes AttributError thrown by utils.CustomUnpickler.

This bug only affects environments in which cPickle is
unavailable (such as Python 3.4).

Attribute error is thrown by CustomUnpickler in
muranodashboard.common.utils.CustomUnpickler.__init__,
when unpickler.noload is referenced.

From the pickle documentation
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/pickle.html):
"Note: the noload() method is currently only available on
Unpickler objects created with the cPickle module. pickle module
Unpicklers do not have the noload() method."

Change-Id: I16161ce27bca7185c02b21ee9c9db2536ec437ca
Closes-Bug: #1647490

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 02:20:21.000000000', 'files': ['collector/collector/api/common/util.py', 'collector/collector/api/config.py', 'migration/manage_migration.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I8432a85b025a46d20484a0d8a3ec72dca54d23cb
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I8432a85b025a46d20484a0d8a3ec72dca54d23cb

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-12 00:59:05.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/drivers/haproxy/namespace_driver.py'], 'message': 'HAProxy - Add host routes to the lbaas namespace

(cherry picked from commit 4a708bfce90e50018a74f3c69a5115458d4c7dcb)

commit_message:
HAProxy - Add host routes to the lbaas namespace

This change adds a loop through the subnet host routes and
if any of this routes have the destination different from
0.0.0.0/0, adds it to the lbaas namespace.

Change-Id: I08cd006faed2291d731768d71149d07592bce301
Closes-Bug: #1635355
(cherry picked from commit 4a708bfce90e50018a74f3c69a5115458d4c7dcb)

3. Make Heat-based driver abstract and update based on
   driver interface changes

Partial-Blueprint: bp-driver-consolodation

commit_message:
Refactor driver interface (pt 1)

Refactor driver interface to encapsulate the orchestration
strategy. This first patch only refactors the main driver
operations. A follow-on will handle the state synchronization
and removing the poller from the conductor.

1. Make driver interface abstract
2. Move external cluster operations into driver interface
3. Make Heat-based driver abstract and update based on
   driver interface changes
4. Move Heat driver code into its own module
5. Update existing Heat drivers based on interface changes

Change-Id: Icfa72e27dc496862d950ac608885567c911f47f2
Partial-Blueprint: bp-driver-consolodation

In latest devstack, nova-serialproxy fails to start because it crashed
when it tries to register the cli options.

The issue is that it tried to register an array of options by invoking
conf.register_cli_opt(), when multiple options need to be register
through conf.register_cli_opts().

Change-Id: Icb09f849290b78b5dd73c3c96a13ade02492ba3a
Closes-Bug: #1647784
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova-serialproxy when registering cli options

In latest devstack, nova-serialproxy fails to start because it crashed
when it tries to register the cli options.

The issue is that it tried to register an array of options by invoking
conf.register_cli_opt(), when multiple options need to be register
through conf.register_cli_opts().

Change-Id: Icb09f849290b78b5dd73c3c96a13ade02492ba3a
Closes-Bug: #1647784

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-19 17:15:20.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/task/legacy_tasks_adapter.py'], 'message': "Remove redundant role based graph cycle checker

This commit removes redundant premature graph cycle checker as
triggers a false-positive exception during conversion or role-based
graph into task-based as it should be firstly preprocessed with sorting
things into several stages, e.g. pre-/post- and deployment stage itself
later. At the same time we have cycle checker in Astute which also does
some graph pre-processing and does not trigger on cycles between
'virtual tasks such as groups

Change-Id: If6a23ca2b924bac308c19d374044de039e370b46
Closes-bug: #1630556
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant role based graph cycle checker

This commit removes redundant premature graph cycle checker as
triggers a false-positive exception during conversion or role-based
graph into task-based as it should be firstly preprocessed with sorting
things into several stages, e.g. pre-/post- and deployment stage itself
later. At the same time we have cycle checker in Astute which also does
some graph pre-processing and does not trigger on cycles between
'virtual tasks such as groups

Change-Id: If6a23ca2b924bac308c19d374044de039e370b46
Closes-bug: #1630556

commit_message:
Add missing per service Keystone config augments

The task for keystone is missing a 'per service' entry for it's config
augments. This means for example that users could not add:

/etc/kolla/config/keystone/keystone-fernet.conf

or

/etc/kolla/config/keystone/keystone.conf

and have keystone.conf augmented for those services only.

Change-Id: I8d2570b4a52dc6c3552397b0a6fa7866133dc2f1
Closes-Bug: #1646898

commit_message:
Make the CLI 'stack-snapshot'consistent with CLI'snapshot-create' in OSC

In heatclient, we use the CLI 'heat stack-snapshot' to make a snapshot
of a stack, While we use 'openstack stack snapshot create' instead.
Then ,I think we can use 'heat snapshot-create' in consistent with
OSC CLI. In addition, we also can keep up with the CLI in heatclient
such as: 'heat snapshot-list', 'heat snapshot-delete', 'heat snapshot-show'.
So, it's better to make this change in heatclient.

Change-Id: I175e066c85caa5e9a304778df3a4664ff3e31b84
closes-bug: #1645956

Ironic role will calculate the UUID of the neutron network assuming a

commit_message:
Add support for neutron network names for cleaning/provisioning

This patch adds the ability to specify a cleaning and provisioning
network for Ironic. If none are specified then Ironic continues to
function as it does now.

Ironic role will calculate the UUID of the neutron network assuming a
network name is provided.

Additionally, this is added to testing by configuring a network to add
with the network-name.

Change-Id: I9be6f351c0da292ac8b861d2168e73d1861e1603

subject: Nova upgrade testing.
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-08 12:15:12.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-install-previous-nova.yml', 'tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'tox.ini', 'tests/upgrades-inventory'], 'message': "Nova upgrade testing.

Implement upgrade testing for os_nova role.

This patch adds an upgrade testenv, which configures a previous version
of Nova, and the test-vars from the previous stable branch to be used
by the previous version of Nova.

We don't run functional tests after the initial stable/newton deploy
because a working stable/newton branch is already tested, and it's
assumed it worked if the upgrade works too - which is more
efficient.

This follows the pattern setup for Keystone in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384269/

TODO: (andymccr)
Nova deprecated the nova_cert project, which means the group has been
removed from the os_nova role. For now a workaround has been added to
add the nova_cert group to the upgrades inventory, the default is to
have nova_cert in it's own container so we could just remove those as
part of an N->O Upgrade.

Change-Id: I3a83c3f91c85ea532d1963c007bb81cae6de2cd7
Implements: blueprint upgrade-testing
"}]
commit_message:
Nova upgrade testing.

Implement upgrade testing for os_nova role.

This patch adds an upgrade testenv, which configures a previous version
of Nova, and the test-vars from the previous stable branch to be used
by the previous version of Nova.

We don't run functional tests after the initial stable/newton deploy
because a working stable/newton branch is already tested, and it's
assumed it worked if the upgrade works too - which is more
efficient.

This follows the pattern setup for Keystone in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384269/

TODO: (andymccr)
Nova deprecated the nova_cert project, which means the group has been
removed from the os_nova role. For now a workaround has been added to
add the nova_cert group to the upgrades inventory, the default is to
have nova_cert in it's own container so we could just remove those as
part of an N->O Upgrade.

Change-Id: I3a83c3f91c85ea532d1963c007bb81cae6de2cd7
Implements: blueprint upgrade-testing

commit_message:
Remove Trusty support from os_swift role

As a part of removing Trusty from OpenStack-Ansible we shall aim to
remove this from all the roles.

Testing has already been removed for Trusty in the integrated build and
all individual repositories on master (Ocata), as such we can now go
ahead and remove the support within the roles.

Change-Id: I89ba35fd15703aba2a05d11d4550690704bdf272
Implements: blueprint trusty-removal

Implement upgrade testing for os_neutron role.

This patch adds an upgrade testenv, which configures a previous version
of Neutron, and the test-vars from the previous stable branch to be used
by the previous version of Neutron.

We don't run functional tests after the initial stable/newton deploy
because a working stable/newton branch is already tested, and it's
assumed it worked if the upgrade works too - which is more

commit_message:
Neutron upgrade testing.

Implement upgrade testing for os_neutron role.

This patch adds an upgrade testenv, which configures a previous version
of Neutron, and the test-vars from the previous stable branch to be used
by the previous version of Neutron.

We don't run functional tests after the initial stable/newton deploy
because a working stable/newton branch is already tested, and it's
assumed it worked if the upgrade works too - which is more
efficient.

This follows the pattern setup for Keystone in:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/384269/

Change-Id: Id4b2cf8197ca902ab5b3d925175c3d7c698ec802
Implements: blueprint upgrade-testing

commit_message:
Enable chrony [+Docs]

This patch enables chrony and performs basic configuration to meet the
STIG requirements.

These tasks can't be enabled in OpenStack CI due to conflicts with existing
NTP daemons in the CI image.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: If6736c0f4a16de1ba41a4cfa00f5f72f8baf0054

commit_message:
Switch from openstack.common to olso_concurrency

The aim is to remove the last user of posix-ipc so it can be removed
from global-requirements.txt.

This commit also re-generates the sample config to reflect the config
group change for 'disable_process_locking' and 'lock_path'.

Change-Id: I777424370dc02c3164803a63331a1befb8531de5

enable constraints.  This in turn needs a newer pbr.

commit_message:
Ensure correct VPNaaS package is installed

Trusty uses `openswan` and Xenial uses `strongswan`. This patch
ensures that the correct packages are installed in each distro
if the deployer chooses to deploy VPNaaS.

commit_message:
Set TMOUT variable for all sessions [+Docs]

This patch sets a session timeout for 10 minutes using the TMOUT environment
variable. Deployers can adjust the timeout from the default if needed.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Iccb49d5fe4517b053e8dcf63a783de04513cf85f

subject: Correct boundary value test in ImagesOneServerNegativeTestJSON
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 03:34:50.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/images/test_images_oneserver_negative.py'], 'message': 'Correct boundary value test in ImagesOneServerNegativeTestJSON

The max character length of name is 255 in create_image, and
we should use the length of 256 for the negative boundary value
test.
Besides, testcase name test_create_image_specify_name_over_256_chars
is not correct, in which 256 should be 255.

see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/index.html?expanded=create-an-image-detail#create-an-image

Change-Id: I924ae3a386f9609a2ce3f6fafe368fa7290435d1
'}]
commit_message:
Correct boundary value test in ImagesOneServerNegativeTestJSON

The max character length of name is 255 in create_image, and
we should use the length of 256 for the negative boundary value
test.
Besides, testcase name test_create_image_specify_name_over_256_chars
is not correct, in which 256 should be 255.

see http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/index.html?expanded=create-an-image-detail#create-an-image

Change-Id: I924ae3a386f9609a2ce3f6fafe368fa7290435d1

subject: Modify the function "_get_spec_version(spec_dict)"
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-12-09 02:07:32.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/workbook/parser.py'], 'message': 'Modify the function "_get_spec_version(spec_dict)"

In the function "_get_spec_version(spec_dict)",
"str(float(ver))"will throw a ValueError when
the value of the vairable "ver" is not number,
such as "aaa".
And if the value of "ver" is "2.0000" the function
will return "2.0000",but it doesn't make sense ,
because when using this function ,it will first
check like this "if _get_spec_version(spec_dict) == V2_0:"

Change-Id: I7dcc582a8c086d1ebc879f9adbeb0fb29fe71941
'}]
commit_message:
Modify the function "_get_spec_version(spec_dict)"

In the function "_get_spec_version(spec_dict)",
"str(float(ver))"will throw a ValueError when
the value of the vairable "ver" is not number,
such as "aaa".
And if the value of "ver" is "2.0000" the function
will return "2.0000",but it doesn't make sense ,
because when using this function ,it will first
check like this "if _get_spec_version(spec_dict) == V2_0:"

Change-Id: I7dcc582a8c086d1ebc879f9adbeb0fb29fe71941

commit_message:
Add cinder profile spec tests

This change adds rspec testing for the cinder profiles with in
puppet-tripleo. Additionally while testing, it was found that the
backends may incorrectly have an extra , included in the settings
for cinder volume when running puppet 3.  This change includes a fix
the cinder volume backends to make sure we are not improperly
configuring it with a trailing comma.

Change-Id: Ibdfee330413b6f9aecdf42a5508c21126fc05973

commit_message:
overcloud-base sets DIB_DEFAULT_INSTALLTYPE=package

This means that the tripleo-image-elements element
enable-packages-install no longer needs to be invoked for overcloud
image builds, advancing our aim of deprecating the entire
tripleo-image-elements repo.

Change-Id: I12620b2a0765a212b45db4a0003a2408b7d114eb

Use local memcached for keystonemiddleware in nova

we need to point nova to local memcached instance for keystone tokens

commit_message:
Add hooks for external install & svc management

This adds defined anchor points for external modules to hook into the
software install, config and service dependency chain.  This allows
external modules to manage software installation (virtualenv,
containers, etc) and service management (pacemaker) without needing rely
on resources that may change or be renamed.

Change-Id: If4f585264f5f5a15549855d97b532866d91f5215

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 02:10:57.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/utils.py', 'tooz/drivers/memcached.py', 'tooz/coordination.py', 'tooz/drivers/redis.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I87a38c8e91953465b904b7d1f79a32643b9274c8
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I87a38c8e91953465b904b7d1f79a32643b9274c8

commit_message:
Add 'deployment_type' configuration parameter

Value of this parameter will be refered in the code to determine
if containers are being launched inside virtual machines or on baremetal
machines.

Partially Implements blueprint containers-in-instances

Change-Id: Icbd561504c9bc39dbf7ef4b0f97561882dd8b1c2

Nested-Containers: vlan driver

Add support to enable isolation of container's traffic within
host(nova instances) using vlan segmentations.

Partially Implements blueprint containers-in-instances

- remove workarounds from cli tests for samples and certification task

subject: Fix bug in ipam_release_address
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 9820, 'name': 'Liping Mao', 'email': 'limao@cisco.com', 'username': 'LipingMao'}, {'_account_id': 12860, 'name': 'Dongcan Ye', 'email': 'yedongcan@yeah.net', 'username': 'yedongcan'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}, {'_account_id': 14867, 'name': 'Jaivish Kothari(janonymous)', 'email': 'janonymous.codevulture@gmail.com', 'username': 'Janonymous'}, {'_account_id': 15967, 'name': 'vikas choudhary', 'email': 'choudharyvikas16@gmail.com', 'username': 'vikaschoudhary16'}, {'_account_id': 17589, 'name': 'Darla Ahlert', 'email': 'da741q@att.com', 'username': 'darla.ahlert'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-09 09:02:01.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/test_kuryr_ipam.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Fix bug in ipam_release_address

When user deallocates an ip address with the given PoolID,
if we have another cidrs with the same subnetpool prefix, at
the same time the give PoolID subnet had already deleted
before(for example: run fullstack test remove_network,
we firstly call DeleteNetwork, and then ReleaseAddress),
we will hit the exception described in LaunchPad.

This patch always check the subnetpool id if we get subnets.

Change-Id: Ia097c3613841619ed2beae2f9d56ec26bc530f69
Closes-Bug: #1644404
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug in ipam_release_address

When user deallocates an ip address with the given PoolID,
if we have another cidrs with the same subnetpool prefix, at
the same time the give PoolID subnet had already deleted
before(for example: run fullstack test remove_network,
we firstly call DeleteNetwork, and then ReleaseAddress),
we will hit the exception described in LaunchPad.

This patch always check the subnetpool id if we get subnets.

Change-Id: Ia097c3613841619ed2beae2f9d56ec26bc530f69
Closes-Bug: #1644404

commit_message:
Add hooks for external install & svc management

This adds defined anchor points for external modules to hook into the
software install, config and service dependency chain.  This allows
external modules to manage software installation (virtualenv,
containers, etc) and service management (pacemaker) without needing rely
on resources that may change or be renamed.

Change-Id: I02a1b403be780b344d436d9b00e649d7e878a53b

commit_message:
Add hooks for external install & svc management

This adds defined anchor points for external modules to hook into the
software install, config and service dependency chain.  This allows
external modules to manage software installation (virtualenv,
containers, etc) and service management (pacemaker) without needing rely
on resources that may change or be renamed.

Change-Id: Ie0fa86a383a19b272a2bdaedb61ede73cad6934f

commit_message:
Add networking-fujitsu support to puppet-neutron

Introduce manifests for networking-fujitsu ML2 plugin. This manifest configures
ml2_conf.ini for networking-fujitsu which drives FUJITSU C-Fabric switch.

Implements: blueprint integration-networking-fujitsu
Change-Id: I37a502b43eb7d91bfe20625248ed117eae3ca535

commit_message:
Changed default for core_plugin to ml2

The 'openvswitch' plugin does not exist since Juno. Also, changed how we
set core_plugin for ML2, using stevedore name instead of import path.

Change-Id: Ifb79ee2e648a5c8ac1defbdb86adca16d0f526ad

commit_message:

subject: Create repo for Enterprise Work Group Workload Reference Architectures.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-02 21:28:42.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/workload-ref-archs.config', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Create repo for Enterprise Work Group Workload Reference Architectures.

The OpenStack Enterprise Work Group is developing a series of
'tenant-level' reference architectures to help users to learn and
understand how to deploy different types of workloads on an OpenStack
Cloud. These reference architectures describe the list of OpenStack
services that can be used to support the workload and provides sample code
to bootstrap the workload environment on an OpenStack Cloud.

This repo will be used to maintain the documents of these reference
architectures and sample code.

Change-Id: Icbb14771e577da74c8212ee6ce32b83ba648d8cd
"}]
commit_message:
Create repo for Enterprise Work Group Workload Reference Architectures.

The OpenStack Enterprise Work Group is developing a series of
'tenant-level' reference architectures to help users to learn and
understand how to deploy different types of workloads on an OpenStack
Cloud. These reference architectures describe the list of OpenStack
services that can be used to support the workload and provides sample code
to bootstrap the workload environment on an OpenStack Cloud.

This repo will be used to maintain the documents of these reference
architectures and sample code.

Change-Id: Icbb14771e577da74c8212ee6ce32b83ba648d8cd

subject: New project proposal: alexandria
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-04 00:52:13.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/alexandria.config'], 'message': 'New project proposal: alexandria

Alexandria provides a service to gather inventories from various bare
metal or virtual machines, on the south interface creates a data model
based on Redfish and interact with CMDBs on the west side, with
deployment tools such as Ironic on the north side, with the availability
of an API to control it on its east side.

Change-Id: I9be3a63d023079c8b057977d1c13e1fe2b8562b3
'}]
commit_message:
New project proposal: alexandria

Alexandria provides a service to gather inventories from various bare
metal or virtual machines, on the south interface creates a data model
based on Redfish and interact with CMDBs on the west side, with
deployment tools such as Ironic on the north side, with the availability
of an API to control it on its east side.

Change-Id: I9be3a63d023079c8b057977d1c13e1fe2b8562b3

commit_message:
ironic: multinode VM count per node increased to 7

In order to run the tempest "smoke" test we need to increase the
Ironic bare-metal VM count per node to 7, from 3. The ironic multinode
job will run tempest "smoke" test in the future and needs the
additional bare-metal VM nodes to run.

subject: Add compatibility macros for SUSE-based systemd macros in RDO
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 7613, 'name': 'Igor Yozhikov', 'email': 'medput@gmail.com', 'username': 'iyozhikov'}, {'_account_id': 13294, 'name': 'Javier Peña', 'email': 'jpena@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpena'}, {'_account_id': 19648, 'name': 'SUSE Cloud CI', 'email': 'dmueller+suse-cloud-ci@suse.de', 'username': 'suse-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 15:16:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/openstack-macros/macros.openstack-rdo'], 'message': 'Add compatibility macros for SUSE-based systemd macros in RDO

SUSE and Fedora use a different set of RPM macros for systemd
services. While they are mostly equivalente, the SUSE macros include
options for migration from System-V scripts, and they are named
differently.

Adding a set of compatibility macros for RDO, so we can translate
the SUSE macros into their equivalent.

Change-Id: I2fddf87e4c67258417da72e637dfbec94081c459
'}]
commit_message:
Add compatibility macros for SUSE-based systemd macros in RDO

SUSE and Fedora use a different set of RPM macros for systemd
services. While they are mostly equivalente, the SUSE macros include
options for migration from System-V scripts, and they are named
differently.

Adding a set of compatibility macros for RDO, so we can translate
the SUSE macros into their equivalent.

Change-Id: I2fddf87e4c67258417da72e637dfbec94081c459
