subject: Added retries for db_sync
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 17:07:59.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/db/sync.pp'], 'message': 'Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: I00051bf680df897fa039fe63a737c518924f448e
Related-Bug: #1628580
Closes-Bug: #1645474
(cherry picked from commit a2cfc7e7778ab2dc8316d613fd014a664940609d)
'}]
commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: I00051bf680df897fa039fe63a737c518924f448e
Related-Bug: #1628580
Closes-Bug: #1645474
(cherry picked from commit a2cfc7e7778ab2dc8316d613fd014a664940609d)

subject: Deprecate disabling UEFI support for inspection
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-07 12:22:01.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/inspector.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/no-disable-uefi-a143b0b143d0b1db.yaml'], 'message': "Deprecate disabling UEFI support for inspection

We only did that because our repositories didn't have necessary firmware
files. Not it seems like all distros ship them, there is no point in disabling
UEFI support.

Change-Id: I0f242a7e1c28c4007b3c2d955dbd3b29086e92f1
"}]
commit_message:
Deprecate disabling UEFI support for inspection

We only did that because our repositories didn't have necessary firmware
files. Not it seems like all distros ship them, there is no point in disabling
UEFI support.

Change-Id: I0f242a7e1c28c4007b3c2d955dbd3b29086e92f1

commit_message:
Add hooks for external install & svc management

This adds defined anchor points for external modules to hook into the
software install, config and service dependency chain.  This allows
external modules to manage software installation (virtualenv,
containers, etc) and service management (pacemaker) without needing rely
on resources that may change or be renamed.

Change-Id: Idc43b06eab3f7103392da699e2a77bb55ce7344d

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I1f50daaa5ae99546ae3b20fca9357f2c87d97167
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I1f50daaa5ae99546ae3b20fca9357f2c87d97167

commit_message:
Delete MidoNet deprecated classes and their tests

MidoNet no longer uses the API component. It has been renamed/refactored
to "cluster" as it can be seen on the docs at
https://blog.midonet.org/introducing-midonet-cluster-services/

Also there is no need to have a Cassandra and Zookeeper dedicated
classes, as we leverage this through the use of the midonet_openstack
puppet module.

Change-Id: I2f17aeeac2d1b121be0d445ff555320d5af5d270
Partial-Bug: #1647302

subject: zookeeper: switch to standard group membership watching
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-12-07 22:40:44.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/drivers/zookeeper.py'], 'message': "zookeeper: switch to standard group membership watching

The current implementation leverages threads and runs the hooks
asynchronously, which is a problem because we can't guarantee the order
of member join/leave. For example if the following happen:

 coord.watch_join_group(x) # takes hours to complete
 coord.watch_leave_group(x) # is very fast
 coord2.join_group(x)
 coord.run_watchers()

It's possible that the callback added in `watch_join_group()' that are
put in the execution queue will be put _after_ the callbacks put by
`watch_leave_group()' and after the watchers are run. That means that
when `run_watchers()' is called, a leave event will be emitted but no
previous join event will be emitted. More, the join event will be
emitted later, putting the system in a wrong state.

This patches drops the async callback push back in queue to run the
common code that is synchronous and serialized and do not have this bug.

Change-Id: Ib289035084cb1a6c4d7e73d4ac1a023591298a8e
"}]
commit_message:
zookeeper: switch to standard group membership watching

The current implementation leverages threads and runs the hooks
asynchronously, which is a problem because we can't guarantee the order
of member join/leave. For example if the following happen:

 coord.watch_join_group(x) # takes hours to complete
 coord.watch_leave_group(x) # is very fast
 coord2.join_group(x)
 coord.run_watchers()

It's possible that the callback added in `watch_join_group()' that are
put in the execution queue will be put _after_ the callbacks put by
`watch_leave_group()' and after the watchers are run. That means that
when `run_watchers()' is called, a leave event will be emitted but no
previous join event will be emitted. More, the join event will be
emitted later, putting the system in a wrong state.

This patches drops the async callback push back in queue to run the
common code that is synchronous and serialized and do not have this bug.

Change-Id: Ib289035084cb1a6c4d7e73d4ac1a023591298a8e

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-01 05:44:58.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/db/migrations/alembic/migrations_data_checks.py', 'manila/db/migrations/alembic/versions/38e632621e5a_change_volume_type_to_share_type.py'], 'message': "Fix wrong data type in database migration

The `deleted` column in volume_type_extra_specs was as a boolean;
The same column in share_type_extra_specs is an integer. However,
the code migrating from volume_types to share_types
assumes them to be vice-versa. This breaks downgrading from that
migration.

Further, the `id` column in share_type_extra_specs is a primary key
field of Integer datatype. Such fields have auto-increment turned on
by default; we shouldn't be copying the `id` from
volume_type_extra_specs when we copy the data.

Fix these bugs and add a unit test.

Change-Id: Ic32a8a17b1b6a773de6dcf7792d9b37f6aed4a3c
Needed-by: Ib0ad5fbfdf6297665c208149b08c8d21b3c232be
Closes-Bug: 1643535
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong data type in database migration

The `deleted` column in volume_type_extra_specs was as a boolean;
The same column in share_type_extra_specs is an integer. However,
the code migrating from volume_types to share_types
assumes them to be vice-versa. This breaks downgrading from that
migration.

Further, the `id` column in share_type_extra_specs is a primary key
field of Integer datatype. Such fields have auto-increment turned on
by default; we shouldn't be copying the `id` from
volume_type_extra_specs when we copy the data.

Fix these bugs and add a unit test.

Change-Id: Ic32a8a17b1b6a773de6dcf7792d9b37f6aed4a3c
Needed-by: Ib0ad5fbfdf6297665c208149b08c8d21b3c232be
Closes-Bug: 1643535

commit_message:
Add hooks for external install & svc management

This adds defined anchor points for external modules to hook into the
software install, config and service dependency chain.  This allows
external modules to manage software installation (virtualenv,
containers, etc) and service management (pacemaker) without needing rely
on resources that may change or be renamed.

Change-Id: I3865efb0908b7883b5c483d87cdf3dffd0ead2d1

commit_message:
Add hooks for external install & svc management

This adds defined anchor points for external modules to hook into the
software install, config and service dependency chain.  This allows
external modules to manage software installation (virtualenv,
containers, etc) and service management (pacemaker) without needing rely
on resources that may change or be renamed.

Change-Id: I281a300df5abfa927b8b6de54f1755ad89ccf563

commit_message:
fix dependencies definition for firewall module

Error is occured when someone tries to install module that
depends on puppetlabs/firewall.
It's occured due to unparsable version range in metadata.json - ">~1.7.0"
This patchset changes '>~' to '>='

Change-Id: If6c11bd5b62afad496091ada50d33b602a487282

subject: Add minimal location rule support to resource creation
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-03 16:14:38.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/resource/lsb.pp', 'manifests/resource/filesystem.pp', 'manifests/resource/route.pp', 'lib/puppet/provider/pcmk_resource/default.rb', 'manifests/resource/systemd.pp', 'manifests/resource/ip.pp', 'manifests/resource/ocf.pp', 'lib/puppet/type/pcmk_resource.rb', 'manifests/resource/service.pp'], 'message': "Add minimal location rule support to resource creation

Currently it is impossible to create a location constraint and a
resource in a non racy way. For example it is not currently possible
to do something like the following:
pacemaker::resource::ocf { 'galera-master': ... }
pacemaker::constraint::location_rule { 'location-galera':
  resource           => 'galera-master',
  expression         => 'galera-role eq true',
  resource_discovery => 'exclusive',
}

The reason the above does not work is that after the resource creation
the pacemaker is free to start the resource wherever it wants and this
can break certain deployments. There are two blessed ways to solve this
via pcs:
1) pcs resource create galera-master ... --disabled
   pcs constraint location rule ...
   pcs resource enable galera-master
2) pcs cluster cib > cib.xml
   pcs -f cib.xml resource create galera-master ...
   pcs -f cib.xml constraint location rule ...
   pcs cluster cib-push cib.xml --config

Both approaches have been tried and the first one, with the addition of
a location_rule parameter to all resources seems to be the less
intrusive one (does not break current users and requires little effort
to use). The second approach was prototyped here:
https://review.openstack.org/402219

Change-Id: I8d78cc1b14f0e18e034b979a826bf3cdb0878bae
"}]
commit_message:
Add minimal location rule support to resource creation

Currently it is impossible to create a location constraint and a
resource in a non racy way. For example it is not currently possible
to do something like the following:
pacemaker::resource::ocf { 'galera-master': ... }
pacemaker::constraint::location_rule { 'location-galera':
  resource           => 'galera-master',
  expression         => 'galera-role eq true',
  resource_discovery => 'exclusive',
}

The reason the above does not work is that after the resource creation
the pacemaker is free to start the resource wherever it wants and this
can break certain deployments. There are two blessed ways to solve this
via pcs:
1) pcs resource create galera-master ... --disabled
   pcs constraint location rule ...
   pcs resource enable galera-master
2) pcs cluster cib > cib.xml
   pcs -f cib.xml resource create galera-master ...
   pcs -f cib.xml constraint location rule ...
   pcs cluster cib-push cib.xml --config

Both approaches have been tried and the first one, with the addition of
a location_rule parameter to all resources seems to be the less
intrusive one (does not break current users and requires little effort
to use). The second approach was prototyped here:
https://review.openstack.org/402219

Change-Id: I8d78cc1b14f0e18e034b979a826bf3cdb0878bae

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-03 21:47:18.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/corosync.pp'], 'message': 'Remove useless etc-pacemaker-authkey -> pcsd dependency

The pcsd service makes no use whatsoever of any authkey files.
Those are only needed by pacemaker once the cluster is up to

Closes-Bug: #1630024

commit_message:
Remove useless etc-pacemaker-authkey -> pcsd dependency

The pcsd service makes no use whatsoever of any authkey files.
Those are only needed by pacemaker once the cluster is up to
configure any pacemaker remote nodes.

Change-Id: I4fc1bfc3dbf2ef9a2f1f266135b2a8dc07efe1ba
Closes-Bug: #1630024

commit_message:
Remove docker_volume_size from functional-test

To unblock our gate, in all the functional tests, create
clusters without cinder volumes.

Change-Id: Ia3b14603c5fc516b00c862c8b9257e0fd23d4b9e
Related-Bug: #1422831

subject: dhcp: don't override default dhcp_driver value
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-08 11:25:08.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_agents_dhcp_spec.rb', 'manifests/agents/dhcp.pp'], 'message': "dhcp: don't override default dhcp_driver value

Dnsmasq driver is already the default for neutron. Actually, the option
is a historic curiosity, and upstream team does not think about the
agent as pluggable. The chance is high pluggability is not working at
all.

Change-Id: I85aa3693a37611ead505a9a30c10907e5dae2211
"}]
commit_message:
dhcp: don't override default dhcp_driver value

Dnsmasq driver is already the default for neutron. Actually, the option
is a historic curiosity, and upstream team does not think about the
agent as pluggable. The chance is high pluggability is not working at
all.

Change-Id: I85aa3693a37611ead505a9a30c10907e5dae2211

commit_message:
dhcp: don't explicitly install dnsmasq

In both supported platforms (Debian and Redhat), the package is pulled
through dependencies, so no need to explicitly install it.

Change-Id: Ia26bc1202e8f274846f78417d0e8a24168f4ce76

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-12-07 15:50:20.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_libnetwork/tests/unit/base.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/server.py', 'kuryr_libnetwork/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Fix default subnetpool assignments from config file

In controllers.py SUBNET_POOLS_V4 and SUBNET_POOLS_V6 are currently
set at file loading, while the config file is only parsed later at
config.init(), resulting in default values being set all the time.
This commit moves the assignments after invoking the init.

Change-Id: Ibac5d9bc7e090e290ee7f09d968634208d7864fb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix default subnetpool assignments from config file

In controllers.py SUBNET_POOLS_V4 and SUBNET_POOLS_V6 are currently
set at file loading, while the config file is only parsed later at
config.init(), resulting in default values being set all the time.
This commit moves the assignments after invoking the init.

Change-Id: Ibac5d9bc7e090e290ee7f09d968634208d7864fb

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-01 21:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['tools/build-install-guides-rst.sh', 'bindep.txt', 'tools/build-rst.sh', 'tools/build-all-rst.sh'], 'message': 'PDF generation support with --pdf option

This commit proposes PDF generation with pdflatex.
Executing Sphinx with latex option generates .tex files will
be performed first, and pdflatex converts from .tex to .pdf files.

More details are as followings:

- Adds texlive related package binary dependency (>= Trusty)
  : inkscape texlive-latex-base texlive-latex-extra
    texlive-fonts-recommended
- build-rst.sh: --pdf option is added
- install-guide PDF support using --pdf option
- PDF support for serveral documents
  : arch-design, cli-reference, ha-guide, ops-guide, user-guide,
    networking-guide, arch-design-draft
  (testable using like "tox -e build -- networking-guide --pdf")
- Intermidiate files for building .tex (required for converting into
  .pdf) are stored in "build/pdf" folder.

Change-Id: I66242f44bb13f1a09be0904a491c84f42f25c3a2
Implements: blueprint build-pdf-from-rst-guides
'}]
commit_message:
PDF generation support with --pdf option

This commit proposes PDF generation with pdflatex.
Executing Sphinx with latex option generates .tex files will
be performed first, and pdflatex converts from .tex to .pdf files.

More details are as followings:

- Adds texlive related package binary dependency (>= Trusty)
  : inkscape texlive-latex-base texlive-latex-extra
    texlive-fonts-recommended
- build-rst.sh: --pdf option is added
- install-guide PDF support using --pdf option
- PDF support for serveral documents
  : arch-design, cli-reference, ha-guide, ops-guide, user-guide,
    networking-guide, arch-design-draft
  (testable using like "tox -e build -- networking-guide --pdf")
- Intermidiate files for building .tex (required for converting into
  .pdf) are stored in "build/pdf" folder.

Change-Id: I66242f44bb13f1a09be0904a491c84f42f25c3a2
Implements: blueprint build-pdf-from-rst-guides

'}]
commit_message:
Fix the case statement

If do not set the case will lead to this lint warning of
"case statement without a default case"

commit_message:
Update ceph::key to update keys

The previous code exited immediatly when one of the shell commands
returned fail. The grep failed when there were no changes between
the temp key and the real key. This resulted in the temp key
not being deleted.

Change-Id: I9ac13efb59e7f575d739107e0fcac66c05504940

[{'number': 28, 'created': '2016-12-08 13:32:29.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/plugins/openstack/scenarios/ceilometer/test_events.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/keystone/basic.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/services/identity/test_keystone_v3.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/services/identity/keystone_common.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/services/identity/test_keystone_v2.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/keystone/utils.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/ceilometer/traits.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/services/identity/identity.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/scenarios/ceilometer/test_traits.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/context/keystone/users.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/ceilometer/events.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/services/identity/test_identity.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/services/identity/keystone_v3.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/scenarios/keystone/test_basic.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/services/identity/keystone_v2.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/services/identity/test_keystone_common.py'], 'message': 'Port all keystone scenarios to Identity Service

Changes:
- All existing keystone scenarios are ported to Identity service
- All existing ceilometer scenarios whcih uses keystone events for checks
  are ported to Identity service
- Module rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/keystone/utils.py is deprecated in
  favour of Identity service
- Methods create_user of Identity service are extended with enabled parameter
- Methods add_role do not return anything any more, since there are no any
  useful responces there at all(in case of error, exception will be raisen)
- Extend Identity service and Keystone V2 & V3 implementations with next
  methods: create_users, get_user, create_service, get_service,
  get_service_by_name, fetch_token, validate_token, list_ec2credentials,
  delete_ec2credential
- Drop "email" argument from create_user method of Identity, since it is
  not common.

Change-Id: I4913f5cf09dc965ab20458cf211cacdff128f195
'}]
commit_message:
Port all keystone scenarios to Identity Service

Changes:
- All existing keystone scenarios are ported to Identity service
- All existing ceilometer scenarios whcih uses keystone events for checks
  are ported to Identity service
- Module rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/keystone/utils.py is deprecated in
  favour of Identity service
- Methods create_user of Identity service are extended with enabled parameter
- Methods add_role do not return anything any more, since there are no any
  useful responces there at all(in case of error, exception will be raisen)
- Extend Identity service and Keystone V2 & V3 implementations with next
  methods: create_users, get_user, create_service, get_service,
  get_service_by_name, fetch_token, validate_token, list_ec2credentials,
  delete_ec2credential
- Drop "email" argument from create_user method of Identity, since it is
  not common.

Change-Id: I4913f5cf09dc965ab20458cf211cacdff128f195

Through [1] ipset members are updated in update_security_group_members
instead of updating during firewall apply. In the same way, we will
delete conntrack entries immediately after deleting remote ipset
members(in update_security_group_members) instead of deleting them after

As explained in [2], this change partially fixes bug #1580377 i.e it

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347068/

commit_message:
Delete conntrack when remote ipset member removed

Through [1] ipset members are updated in update_security_group_members
instead of updating during firewall apply. In the same way, we will
delete conntrack entries immediately after deleting remote ipset
members(in update_security_group_members) instead of deleting them after
firewall apply.

As explained in [2], this change partially fixes bug #1580377 i.e it
deletes conntrack entries on remote hosts for a removed port.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/347068/
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1580377/comments/13

Co-Authored-By:shihanzhang <shihanzhang@huawei.com>
Partial-Bug: #1580377
Change-Id: Iea3344a24e2a068b794c44796b4c945432379c13

commit_message:
ID should be biginteger in resource routing table

1. What is the problem?
Currently the id in resource routing table is integer, the scope of integer is
very limited, so it should be replaced with biginteger.

2. What is the solution to the problem?
Replacing the integer with biginteger will fix this problem. What's more,
API documentation should be updated at the same time.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle to realize
the solution?
None.

Change-Id: I2be59348965fb21b6865a3646fa7201b62e46d02

commit_message:
Fix README.rst

1.What is the problem?
All links in the README must be under openstack.org not github.com
or google.com

2.What is the solution to the problem?
We fix the README.rst and index.rst

3.What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
  to realize the solution?
No new features.

Change-Id: I9f9e8f8334c93a11826d7fdf50d8c9fea86502a9
Closes-Bug: #1605188

subject: Modify variable's using method in Log Messages
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-17 01:37:23.000000000', 'files': ['trove/conductor/api.py', 'trove/common/strategies/cluster/experimental/galera_common/api.py', 'trove/taskmanager/api.py', 'trove/tests/fakes/nova.py', 'trove/guestagent/api.py', 'trove/common/strategies/cluster/experimental/cassandra/api.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/manager.py'], 'message': "Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code, 
rather than being done at the point of the logging call. 
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: Ifd0a72a4d22812f27970eb318ad8a6e4b4b68633
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's using method in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code, 
rather than being done at the point of the logging call. 
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: Ifd0a72a4d22812f27970eb318ad8a6e4b4b68633

subject: Set import exceptions in tox.ini configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-01 09:31:16.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Set import exceptions in tox.ini configuration

Instead of "from i18n import _ 
            from i18n import _LE"
this style "from i18n import _, _LE" is recommended as following:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#real-world-import-order-examples
but the pep8 failed: H301 one import per line
so it needs to set import exceptions in tox.ini to avoid the problem

Change-Id: I203dbf0c14714d5b4605651133f117d42f2c9d26
'}]
commit_message:
Set import exceptions in tox.ini configuration

Instead of "from i18n import _ 
            from i18n import _LE"
this style "from i18n import _, _LE" is recommended as following:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#real-world-import-order-examples
but the pep8 failed: H301 one import per line
so it needs to set import exceptions in tox.ini to avoid the problem

Change-Id: I203dbf0c14714d5b4605651133f117d42f2c9d26

Change-Id: I1319408f1bedcaa166e809eafb2fb00e6a1aa051

commit_message:
Fix stable newton dependencies

Changes in upstream neutron broke the stable version. Hence we
needed to do the following:
1. ensure that the upper constraints are set correctly
2. make sure that stable/newton is pulled for newton
3. needed to skip H305-H307 about import orders

Change-Id: I1319408f1bedcaa166e809eafb2fb00e6a1aa051

subject: Let Nova to pick availability zone if more than 1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-29 16:04:39.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-model.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/details/details.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-model.service.spec.js'], 'message': "Let Nova to pick availability zone if more than 1

In the Angular Launch Instance, if there is more than one availability zone,
default to the option for the Nova scheduler to pick.  This is a regression
from the legacy Launch Instance feature.

If you want to simulate testing the logic with multiple avaiability zones,
go to:  .../launch-instance/launch-instance-model.service.js line 785 and add:

model.availabilityZones.push({label: 'another one', value: 'another one'});

Change-Id: Ib81447382bc9d43e33ce97f78c085d2a94ff2018
Closes-Bug: 1613900
"}]
commit_message:
Let Nova to pick availability zone if more than 1

In the Angular Launch Instance, if there is more than one availability zone,
default to the option for the Nova scheduler to pick.  This is a regression
from the legacy Launch Instance feature.

If you want to simulate testing the logic with multiple avaiability zones,
go to:  .../launch-instance/launch-instance-model.service.js line 785 and add:

model.availabilityZones.push({label: 'another one', value: 'another one'});

Change-Id: Ib81447382bc9d43e33ce97f78c085d2a94ff2018
Closes-Bug: 1613900

subject: Remove upper cap for psutil
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-09 00:31:36.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove upper cap for psutil

psutil was capped in early 2014 for no particular reason, lets
see if we can uncap it since distributions in general like to
move to a newer version since amongst other things it provides
a lot more fixes. Also bump minimum to the upper constraint since
thats likely our real lower bound meanwhile given that its
been at that value for more than two years.

Change-Id: If8d68ac124745c712e35464d6fbfab4073624564
'}]
commit_message:
Remove upper cap for psutil

psutil was capped in early 2014 for no particular reason, lets
see if we can uncap it since distributions in general like to
move to a newer version since amongst other things it provides
a lot more fixes. Also bump minimum to the upper constraint since
thats likely our real lower bound meanwhile given that its
been at that value for more than two years.

Change-Id: If8d68ac124745c712e35464d6fbfab4073624564

commit_message:
Consolidate qos v1 driver classes

Previously, design from mech_driver was followed to keep
CRUD method definitions for qos policy in a separate class,
for qos v1 driver. It is no longer needed and consolidated
into single class.

Change-Id: I374453e2a4cca608fc91a5eaf762e7a7f9f19290
Closes-Bug: #1648035

commit_message:
Helm make haproxy optional in common_deployment

This commit makes haproxy optional for common deployments, it
is expected that by default operators will want this but some services
may run behind apache or operators may use an ingress controller for l7
services, making it unessisary.

Change-Id: I114d684a38b5601c93b20729d3354eab231766fe

commit_message:
Modify "from tempest.common.utils import data_utils"

In many modules, "from tempest.common.utils import data_utils" was
written. Actually, the module "data_utils.py" is in the package
"tempest.lib.common.utils". So that import statement is replaced with
"from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils".

Change-Id: I30292e7adb10847180d72cf03bf1189d3129650c

subject: Make bootstrap idempotent when it needs to be
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-08 21:01:11.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/cmd/cli.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_cli.py'], 'message': "Make bootstrap idempotent when it needs to be

This commit makes `keystone-manage bootstrap` completely idempotent
when configuration values or environment variables haven't changed
between runs. If they have changed, then `bootstrap` shouldn't be
as idempotent becuase it's changing the state of the deployment.

This commit addresses these issues and adds tests to ensure the
proper behavior is tested.

Change-Id: I053b27e881f5bb67db1ace01e6d06aead10b1e47
Closes-Bug: 1647800
"}]
commit_message:
Make bootstrap idempotent when it needs to be

This commit makes `keystone-manage bootstrap` completely idempotent
when configuration values or environment variables haven't changed
between runs. If they have changed, then `bootstrap` shouldn't be
as idempotent becuase it's changing the state of the deployment.

This commit addresses these issues and adds tests to ensure the
proper behavior is tested.

Change-Id: I053b27e881f5bb67db1ace01e6d06aead10b1e47
Closes-Bug: 1647800

commit_message:
Fixups for ghost listing fix

I think the probetest can be a little more pathological and I'm worried
about logging the response of each individual request at error when we
currently only log the entire failure at debug.

I have lots of async pendings sometimes.

Related-Change: Ic5d55ff368cec62ab2eb9fd883801ba4ab043dd4
Change-Id: I1c070b2b07d31552f36b647731b0b3ebed31871f

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-08 19:45:31.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/backend/netapp.pp'], 'message': 'Fix duplicate declaration between manila/tripleO

There is a outside case where a user may use triple-O to stand up a
control node that has manila, cinder, and an nfs server.  This causes
a duplicate declaration of Package[nfs-utils].

addresses bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1400557

Change-Id: Ie89331396285a181f21a4d55715fd522965bd142
'}]
commit_message:
Fix duplicate declaration between manila/tripleO

There is a outside case where a user may use triple-O to stand up a
control node that has manila, cinder, and an nfs server.  This causes
a duplicate declaration of Package[nfs-utils].

addresses bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1400557

Change-Id: Ie89331396285a181f21a4d55715fd522965bd142

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-18 13:53:04.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/common/client_config.py'], 'message': 'Use project_domain_id only in password auth

The method being changed constructs domain-related parameters that will
further be passed to the auth plugin. If project domain is not
passed, the method sets it to the default domain.

token_endpoint does not expect any information about domain,
because it uses only a token and URL. Passing it to auth plugin causes
an exception.

Construct domain-related parameters only for specific plugins, such
as password or totp.

Change-Id: I13db3bbe31a0ed843e9f4528d37c768546e2bee9
Closes-Bug: 1642301
'}]
commit_message:
Use project_domain_id only in password auth

The method being changed constructs domain-related parameters that will
further be passed to the auth plugin. If project domain is not
passed, the method sets it to the default domain.

token_endpoint does not expect any information about domain,
because it uses only a token and URL. Passing it to auth plugin causes
an exception.

Construct domain-related parameters only for specific plugins, such
as password or totp.

Change-Id: I13db3bbe31a0ed843e9f4528d37c768546e2bee9
Closes-Bug: 1642301

subject: Add support for centos and opensuse
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 11:08:48.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/functions', 'scripts/redstack'], 'message': "Add support for centos and opensuse

Originally when I tried to install trove with redstack file, it replied me that dnf was not found on my system.

Considering CentOS doesn't supports dnf while Fedora still supports yum, I think it is approperate to use yum to install packages instead of dnf.

Stole more functions from devstack, and add support for suse.

Change-Id: I67287cc33e60f053157ce9e8ead261edbb9613d4
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for centos and opensuse

Originally when I tried to install trove with redstack file, it replied me that dnf was not found on my system.

Considering CentOS doesn't supports dnf while Fedora still supports yum, I think it is approperate to use yum to install packages instead of dnf.

Stole more functions from devstack, and add support for suse.

Change-Id: I67287cc33e60f053157ce9e8ead261edbb9613d4

This ps should reduce the change of gate failure as a result of

commit_message:
Pull kube-system images as part of CNI setup

This ps should reduce the change of gate failure as a result of
not all pods in kube-system coming online in 180s. It does this
by pulling all images in kube-system before starting the
wait-online script. This pulls kube-system inline with the kolla
namespace gate methodology.

Change-Id: Idbb96ec697e2f3f6f36f24f26378fe80669314ff

subject: Don't trace on ImageNotFound in delete_image_on_error
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-08 19:06:43.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Don't trace on ImageNotFound in delete_image_on_error

The point of the delete_image_on_error decorator is to
cleanup an image used during snapshot operations, so it
makes little sense to log an exception trace if the image
delete fails because the image no longer exists, which it
might not since _snapshot_instance method will proactively
delete non-active images in certain situations.

So let's just handle the ImageNotFound and ignore it.

Change-Id: I14e061a28678ad28e38bd185e3d0a35cae41a9cf
Closes-Bug: #1648574
"}]
commit_message:
Don't trace on ImageNotFound in delete_image_on_error

The point of the delete_image_on_error decorator is to
cleanup an image used during snapshot operations, so it
makes little sense to log an exception trace if the image
delete fails because the image no longer exists, which it
might not since _snapshot_instance method will proactively
delete non-active images in certain situations.

So let's just handle the ImageNotFound and ignore it.

Change-Id: I14e061a28678ad28e38bd185e3d0a35cae41a9cf
Closes-Bug: #1648574

commit_message:
Return 400 when name is more than 200 characters

APIs listed below are returning 500 error if you pass name more than
200 characters.
1. create resource_providers
2. update resource_providers

Added maxLength check in schema to ensure name should not be more than
200 characters.

Closes-Bug: #1642485

subject: Hard-code neutron setup for rally jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 01:04:10.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/rally.yaml'], 'message': 'Hard-code neutron setup for rally jobs

Change [1] switched to using neutron as default networking backend for
rally runs. However neutron is default for Ocata and above, thus leaving
DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON unspecified means that runs on stable branches are
still going to pick up nova-net, and that breaks rally on neutron stable
backports.

This patch set DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON for all active branches.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408020

Change-Id: I75f4ace1f2b9ddf2aa5426d859cb8518b33bf579
'}]
commit_message:
Hard-code neutron setup for rally jobs

Change [1] switched to using neutron as default networking backend for
rally runs. However neutron is default for Ocata and above, thus leaving
DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON unspecified means that runs on stable branches are
still going to pick up nova-net, and that breaks rally on neutron stable
backports.

This patch set DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON for all active branches.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408020

Change-Id: I75f4ace1f2b9ddf2aa5426d859cb8518b33bf579

commit_message:
Adds distribution ID option to diskimage-create.sh

This patch adds a distribution ID option to the diskimage-create.sh
script used to create amphora images.  This will allow octavia
to control the timing of the transition to a new default release.
For Ocata it will default to "xenial".

Change-Id: I435cf9f4723fc9e68f8cb8987c8316b09e6876b6
Closes-Bug: 1642756
(cherry picked from commit 2db260c95a326404d4ea4a33efe6c4151f29fb59)

commit_message:
Move sync_db parameter to glance::api

Glance Registry will at some point be removed from puppet-glance once
API v1 is totally remove from Glance tree.
Some people using 100% v2 API don't need Glance Registry, so they don't
have to run glance::registry class. Though they need the db_sync, so
this patch aims to move the db_sync parameter from glance::registry to
glance::api.

The parameter in glance::registry is deprecated and will be removed in a
future release. Now people should use glance::api::sync_db.

Change-Id: Ib554edb13386845198140c87b0a9b931500656d2

subject: Expose idempotency issue with bootstrap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 15:57:51.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_cli.py'], 'message': "Expose idempotency issue with bootstrap

During some upgrade testing I was doing locally, I noticed an issue
where `keystone-manage bootstrap` isn't completely idempotent. This
is because `bootstrap` has the ability to recover lost admin accounts
by reseting the admin user's enabled status and updating their
password, regardless of it being different. This creates a revocation
event and causes admin tokens to be invalid after bootstrap is run
for a second time, making it not as idempotent as we'd like.

This commit introduces a test that exposes this behavior.

Change-Id: I627255b2b5d6ec401af2c07c4018930fea206e4a
Partial-Bug: 1647800
"}]
commit_message:
Expose idempotency issue with bootstrap

During some upgrade testing I was doing locally, I noticed an issue
where `keystone-manage bootstrap` isn't completely idempotent. This
is because `bootstrap` has the ability to recover lost admin accounts
by reseting the admin user's enabled status and updating their
password, regardless of it being different. This creates a revocation
event and causes admin tokens to be invalid after bootstrap is run
for a second time, making it not as idempotent as we'd like.

This commit introduces a test that exposes this behavior.

Change-Id: I627255b2b5d6ec401af2c07c4018930fea206e4a
Partial-Bug: 1647800

commit_message:
Do not fail with yaml files without a release

Change I9b9c776aad8acbdbb002a8e6615e3bf90095b2ca added deliverable
yaml files without any release.
Just skip these files and do not fail in that case.
This fixes:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "rpm-packaging-status.py", line 336, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "rpm-packaging-status.py", line 286, in main
    v_release = find_highest_release_version(data['releases'])
KeyError: 'releases'

Change-Id: Iae5a086e53e6ea8568cd2193a7199305c9c43f1e

commit_message:
Add new dependency statsd for oslo_middleware

This enables a new middleware that sends wsgi pipeline timing data to
StatsD (and hence Graphite).

It's packaged in all of Ubuntu, CentOS, SuSE and Gentoo, works with
Python 3, looks maintained and has reasonable code quality.

Change-Id: I53dd9116b1c154ffcc3ea2d6b75ecee0061e4866

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1921, 'name': 'Andrea Frittoli', 'email': 'andrea.frittoli@gmail.com', 'username': 'andrea-frittoli'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11869, 'name': 'zhubingbing', 'email': 'zhu.bingbing@99cloud.net', 'username': 'zhubingbing'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22692, 'name': 'guo yunxian', 'email': 'yunxian.guo@easystack.cn', 'username': 'guoyunxian'}, {'_account_id': 23184, 'name': 'DavidPurcell', 'email': 'd.purcell222@gmail.com', 'username': 'DavidPurcell'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-21 18:56:07.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/identity/v3/test_tokens.py'], 'message': 'Pass username on v3 token issue

The v3 test_create_token test was failing when no username was
specified in the accounts.yaml file. It was actually making an
invalid request rather than creating the request using the
username.

The underlying get_token method actually supports making a
request with username or password so looks like it was just a
mistake not passing the username.

Also, added support for unspecified fields in accounts.yaml.
Rather than fail because the server returns a user ID when
none is specified, just validate that a user ID is present
if no user ID is specified.

Change-Id: Ie91f615c16d4e898f4fe2bbe942303ba51418cbb
'}]
commit_message:
Pass username on v3 token issue

The v3 test_create_token test was failing when no username was
specified in the accounts.yaml file. It was actually making an
invalid request rather than creating the request using the
username.

The underlying get_token method actually supports making a
request with username or password so looks like it was just a
mistake not passing the username.

Also, added support for unspecified fields in accounts.yaml.
Rather than fail because the server returns a user ID when
none is specified, just validate that a user ID is present
if no user ID is specified.

Change-Id: Ie91f615c16d4e898f4fe2bbe942303ba51418cbb

commit_message:
Fix git_root default in README

for the role `bifrost-prep-for-install`, the README incorrectly states
that default for `git_root` is "/tmp" while actually its `defaults/main.yml`
has it as "/opt/stack".

Change-Id: Ia6cb46f48ee265ee8aca8e87cda12886ca3ea0e4

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-14 20:24:38.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/emc/test_emc_vmax.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_common.py'], 'message': "VMAX driver - Ensure VMAX volume matches cinder db volume

The VMAX cinder driver locates volumes on the backend by
using the volume's backend 'DeviceID'. It does not check
to ensure the volume retrieved matches the volume in the
cinder database. This can cause inconsistencies in cinder,
where a volume may be deleted off the backend, but remains
in the cinder database. This patch addresses the issue by
ensuring the 'ElementName' of the volume retrieved matches
the VMAX cinder driver element name ('OS-' + cinder UUID).

Change-Id: I8da37cd772d24fbb63a6fb12ccd782ffb4fef5c2
Closes-Bug: #1401297
"}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Ensure VMAX volume matches cinder db volume

The VMAX cinder driver locates volumes on the backend by
using the volume's backend 'DeviceID'. It does not check
to ensure the volume retrieved matches the volume in the
cinder database. This can cause inconsistencies in cinder,
where a volume may be deleted off the backend, but remains
in the cinder database. This patch addresses the issue by
ensuring the 'ElementName' of the volume retrieved matches
the VMAX cinder driver element name ('OS-' + cinder UUID).

Change-Id: I8da37cd772d24fbb63a6fb12ccd782ffb4fef5c2
Closes-Bug: #1401297

commit_message:
Fix missing subnetpool_id in neutron subnet

If there is no subnetpool name option in libnetwork request, new
subnet created with missing subnetpool.

This patch fetching subnetpool by pool_cidr params.

Change-Id: Ifecb7a70b838b20aa1f1e93550c9fcef119135a5
Closes-bug: #1634379

subject: Use a new token for heat client
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-23 18:50:42.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/heat.py'], 'message': 'Use a new token for heat client

When switching project, the session token is revoked by
django_openstack_auth as a fix to endlessly growing list of session
tokens per Bug 1227754.

The revocation of the token, however, will cause Heat operations to fail
if Heat still requires the token after user switches projects. This
happens often when launching a stack with token only and user switching
project immediately thereafter.

This change creates a new token for use with heat client. The new token
is reused for the same session as the heatclient object is memorized.
The new token is not tracked or added to session token list thus it does
not defeat the original intention of revoking the session token to fix
Bug 1227754.

Change-Id: I51c501f58c6078967bd635860aa1e0c3d670aa5b
Closes-Bug: #1515707
'}]
commit_message:
Use a new token for heat client

When switching project, the session token is revoked by
django_openstack_auth as a fix to endlessly growing list of session
tokens per Bug 1227754.

The revocation of the token, however, will cause Heat operations to fail
if Heat still requires the token after user switches projects. This
happens often when launching a stack with token only and user switching
project immediately thereafter.

This change creates a new token for use with heat client. The new token
is reused for the same session as the heatclient object is memorized.
The new token is not tracked or added to session token list thus it does
not defeat the original intention of revoking the session token to fix
Bug 1227754.

Change-Id: I51c501f58c6078967bd635860aa1e0c3d670aa5b
Closes-Bug: #1515707

commit_message:
Don't use absolute path on executing scsi_id

Rootwrap expects the command name is not absolute. We need to call
the command without path to make rootwrap work well.

Change-Id: I4f8ade1c53c9d183525a869f8ec562a1ccdc85dc
Closes-Bug: #1644020

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/f85631540f7457a0a49eb0d061697d9c\n'

Change-Id: I3d6c847e0d4657c46ce892db7a460cd1f25b81d2

This patch completely fixes the nova controler install for Debian:

  * Remove use_neutron and firewall_driver, as default is already good
    in Debian.
  * Disable [spice] and enable [vnc] correctly

commit_message:
Fix nova controler install-guide for debian

This patch completely fixes the nova controler install for Debian:

  * Remove use_neutron and firewall_driver, as default is already good
    in Debian.
  * Disable [spice] and enable [vnc] correctly
  * Go around a current packaging issue with systemd unit for novnc

Change-Id: Ifcea959de413fce2256a23245ac8b0e23c0ec863

commit_message:
Install MariaDB 10.1 server

Update repos and packages to install the server for MariaDB 10.1, the
current stable release.

Several improvements have been made to improve the upgrade process and
an upgrade from 10.0 has been included in the test playbooks.

Make use of the yum_repository module for installing on yum based
systems and give the apt repository files consistent names, 'MariaDB'
and 'Percona' for easier maintenance and handling of upgrades going
forward.

Depends-On: I8939703f26e5d8adc393b984266f4cad7a6e0b4c
Change-Id: Ib6409f1fcf4a664b65dbe01372a19509d02d70a4

Add proxy configuration for apt-cacher-ng

apt-cacher-ng does not use environment variable and proxy needs to
be set in apt-cacher-ng configuration file.

commit_message:
Enable AIDE [+Docs]

This patch installs AIDE and optionally initializes the AIDE database. A
cron job is also deployed for CentOS/RHEL since it doesn't come with
the AIDE package itself.

Documentation is included.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: Iae04c95903960deee2d750037c08b50c4ce4f800

commit_message:
Add additional options to unbound

This adds prefetch and interface options to an additional unbound
configuration file. These options will limit the interfaces
unbound can use and should improving performance by caching
records.

Change-Id: I2630ee057dd7e41e98a81a7fed3f22024bb23417
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Sync latest neutron context into lib

This patch updates neutron_lib._context with the latest
from neutron prior to publishing the module for wider
adoption.

In particular, this one brings in the following:

1) Ic58a2025680e8e1ba4f8a177d898be457e2c3160
2) I0533c8aee3893449b757f1e35fc89a451ae1720c

commit_message:
Add HCTL to BlockDevices

This patch is adding a "hctl" attribute to the BlockDevices. HCTL stands
for: Host, Channel, Target and Lun, which is basically the SCSI address.

The idea behind this patch is to allow root device hints to find the
disk for deployment based on the SCSI address.

Partial-Bug: #1648036
Change-Id: If8897c68609e0df0378ee919b803ca5e497def02

commit_message:
Change job-suffix to suffix

We have now some rather long job-template names, shorten them with
replacing job-suffix with suffix.

Before this change we had 1500 usages of job-suffix and 700 of just
suffix. This change therefore unifies to one setting.

Note that this does not change any job names at all, they are unchanged,
it changes and shortens only the names of job-templates.

Change-Id: I514df039a848d9f6619bca3adc05dfb84a761fc9

subject: Fixes traceback if group name attribute is missing
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-23 13:53:51.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/keystone_data.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/projects/workflows.py'], 'message': 'Fixes traceback if group name attribute is missing

This works around an issue where certain backends (e.g. LDAP)
did not provide a group name, only ID, which would cause most
identity management tasks in Horizon to fail. If no name is
provided, the ID is duplicated as the group name.

Change-Id: Iea87abf38d26cb2baff43521c7dd2ae0a00e9997
Closes-Bug: #1593571
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes traceback if group name attribute is missing

This works around an issue where certain backends (e.g. LDAP)
did not provide a group name, only ID, which would cause most
identity management tasks in Horizon to fail. If no name is
provided, the ID is duplicated as the group name.

Change-Id: Iea87abf38d26cb2baff43521c7dd2ae0a00e9997
Closes-Bug: #1593571

revisions:

commit_message:
Use assertGreater(len(x), 0) instead of assertTrue(len(x) > 0)

assertGreater provides a nicer error message if it fails.

commit_message:
Mock ironic-lib properly in test_deploy_utils

Many of the tests in this file asserted that methods internal to
ironic-lib were called. This has caused gate failures in the past when
ironic-lib changes internal logic.

This mocks out ironic-lib so we only test that the correct methods are
called from ironic's perspective as an external consumer of ironic-lib.

Change-Id: I91d3c7d7b8f4dd6b7652e0cac90ea562ae710636
Partial-Bug: #1552843
Co-Authored-By: John L. Villalovos <john.l.villalovos@intel.com>

subject: Use get-pip script from repo release folder
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-07 10:06:35.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/lxc-hosts-setup.yml', 'playbooks/repo-build.yml', 'playbooks/common-tasks/set-pip-upstream-url.yml', 'playbooks/unbound-install.yml', 'playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml', 'ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'playbooks/repo-server.yml'], 'message': "Use get-pip script from repo release folder

This patch ensures that if the local repo server has a copy of the
get-pip.py script then it will be used instead of reaching out to
the default location on the internet.

The tasks to set upper constraints are removed form the unbound
and repo-server playbooks as those roles do not execute any form
of pip installation.

This approach is taken to ensure that:

- Before the repo is built, the get-pip process in the pip_install
  role still has two chances to fetch the get-pip.py script. If we
  simply override the first URL option in group_vars then the
  initial task will fail before the repo is built for the release
  being executed and we would therefore only get one fallback.

- After the repo is built, if the lxc-host-setup and other pre-repo
  playbooks are run, the plays will use the repo's get-pip script
  instead of reaching upstream to fetch a fresh one. This maintains
  a consistent get-pip script version within the same tag forever.
  If group_vars are set for the targets of these plays to use the
  upstream URL then the experience is not the same - the lxc_hosts
  group will always get the latest upstream get-pip script every
  time the playbook executes, resulting in the lxc hosts having a
  different copy of the script to other hosts and containers.

Partial-Bug: #1633105
Depends-On: I3735ec50d51e10d0bc4a7f6677a800444fb33912
Depends-On: I4a2ff6c6e5cd40d87d4218f63c09e96da82da1aa
Change-Id: I9b558a14e800bb77d78021f665173dcdfaf2f4aa
(cherry picked from commit 47d3f8733f76d567d2f578be20894bdfc5a6246c)
"}]
commit_message:
Use get-pip script from repo release folder

This patch ensures that if the local repo server has a copy of the
get-pip.py script then it will be used instead of reaching out to
the default location on the internet.

The tasks to set upper constraints are removed form the unbound
and repo-server playbooks as those roles do not execute any form
of pip installation.

This approach is taken to ensure that:

- Before the repo is built, the get-pip process in the pip_install
  role still has two chances to fetch the get-pip.py script. If we
  simply override the first URL option in group_vars then the
  initial task will fail before the repo is built for the release
  being executed and we would therefore only get one fallback.

- After the repo is built, if the lxc-host-setup and other pre-repo
  playbooks are run, the plays will use the repo's get-pip script
  instead of reaching upstream to fetch a fresh one. This maintains
  a consistent get-pip script version within the same tag forever.
  If group_vars are set for the targets of these plays to use the
  upstream URL then the experience is not the same - the lxc_hosts
  group will always get the latest upstream get-pip script every
  time the playbook executes, resulting in the lxc hosts having a
  different copy of the script to other hosts and containers.

Partial-Bug: #1633105
Depends-On: I3735ec50d51e10d0bc4a7f6677a800444fb33912
Depends-On: I4a2ff6c6e5cd40d87d4218f63c09e96da82da1aa
Change-Id: I9b558a14e800bb77d78021f665173dcdfaf2f4aa
(cherry picked from commit 47d3f8733f76d567d2f578be20894bdfc5a6246c)

commit_message:
Missing info on MELLON_IDP for mod_auth_mellon

The identity provider creation page is missing information on mellon,
one of the SAML2 modules keystone supports. When using mod_auth_mellon,
a user should enter MELLON_IDP for the remote ID.

See the section that discusses remote_id_attribute in:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/federation/websso.html

Change-Id: I5cc16997ad388f79146d02b352938a48291b2dfb

commit_message:
Make the release file options more configurable

Downstream deployers may want not to deploy the
/etc/openstack-release file, or to customise the
contents.

This patch makes the file drop optional, but also
makes the contents more configurable.

Backport note:
The changes made in https://review.openstack.org/396575
are also included as they seem to be more sensible
values.

Change-Id: I549a23f2f08dfb97ca8daa36f00437d927de30a5
(cherry picked from commit dde8effbd068da8de4271b62875e1fffae89c1c5)

subject: Reset flavors for other than "Boot from Image" source type.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 08:46:30.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/static/horizon/js/horizon.instances.js'], 'message': 'Reset flavors for other than "Boot from Image" source type.

If a launched instance from "Boot from image" source type is not
meeting the given image RAM/disk requirements, the "Flavor" field
of Launch Instance will display the below message.

"Some flavors not meeting minimum image requirements have been
disabled."

And the flavors that are not meeting the specified requirements
will be disabled under "Flavor" field.

After this message has been shown if we try to choose a source
type other than "Boot from image", the flavors are still in
disabled mode and message also not being cleared.

To fix this issue, Set the image name to default when the source type
is changed from "Boot from image" to other source type.So that
disableFlavorsForImage() has been called on Image name change to
reset flavors.

Change-Id: I1a105eb84bd5d92ad521d9a8ae290912d48cf275
Closes-Bug: #1482507
(cherry picked from commit b1373e0438c19485f3b0223e93948b5d4519c7ae)
'}]
commit_message:
Reset flavors for other than "Boot from Image" source type.

If a launched instance from "Boot from image" source type is not
meeting the given image RAM/disk requirements, the "Flavor" field
of Launch Instance will display the below message.

"Some flavors not meeting minimum image requirements have been
disabled."

And the flavors that are not meeting the specified requirements
will be disabled under "Flavor" field.

After this message has been shown if we try to choose a source
type other than "Boot from image", the flavors are still in
disabled mode and message also not being cleared.

To fix this issue, Set the image name to default when the source type
is changed from "Boot from image" to other source type.So that
disableFlavorsForImage() has been called on Image name change to
reset flavors.

Change-Id: I1a105eb84bd5d92ad521d9a8ae290912d48cf275
Closes-Bug: #1482507
(cherry picked from commit b1373e0438c19485f3b0223e93948b5d4519c7ae)

commit_message:
Set noop network driver for ironicclient func tests

This environment doesn't have neutron enabled, and the default network
driver depends on neutron when doing node validation. As such, node
validation is broken and so tests are broken. Enable only the noop
network driver to unbreak this.

Change-Id: Ic396777ad8ec64e6927608b8d5bcffb0596e0284
Closes-Bug: #1648179

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5805, 'name': 'Chris Krelle', 'email': 'nobodycam@gmail.com', 'username': 'nobodycam'}, {'_account_id': 8259, 'name': 'Andrey Shestakov', 'email': 'ashestakov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ashestakov'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 18:01:00.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-keystone-install/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': 'Provide default to uwsgi_install_prefix

due to how Ansible works, the expressions in `with_items` are still
evaluated even when run under `when` statement.

Due to this, the bifrost-keystone-install role failed in
tasks/bootstrap.yml when trying to place uwsgi services when keystone
was not actually installed as it was trying to evaluate
uwsgi_install_prefix.stdout while the task registering this var was
actually skipped.

This patch provides default to this evalation in the form of empty
string.

Change-Id: Id16f680853e5710deed5954c891b7e3ec83f16d2
'}]
commit_message:
Provide default to uwsgi_install_prefix

due to how Ansible works, the expressions in `with_items` are still
evaluated even when run under `when` statement.

Due to this, the bifrost-keystone-install role failed in
tasks/bootstrap.yml when trying to place uwsgi services when keystone
was not actually installed as it was trying to evaluate
uwsgi_install_prefix.stdout while the task registering this var was
actually skipped.

This patch provides default to this evalation in the form of empty
string.

Change-Id: Id16f680853e5710deed5954c891b7e3ec83f16d2

commit_message:
make trove's ubuntu-xenial jobs voting

Commit I8e1de6ef31f969ccee88c334a0d5ed03aabd1b51 enables the running
the gating trusty jobs to also run on xenial. This change makes the
change in project-config to reflect that.

Remove the trusty functional jobs that run on master only, use the
xenial ones.

Changes are similarly made in python-troveclient.

Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <aj@suse.com>
Change-Id: Ia6442376094938ac44176e27b914e83b401156ec
Depends-On: I8e1de6ef31f969ccee88c334a0d5ed03aabd1b51

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-21 17:24:39.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/api/v1/behaviors/secret_behaviors.py', 'functionaltests/run_tests.sh', 'barbican/api/controllers/secrets.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_secrets.py'], 'message': 'Pass secret_type to repository query

In the secrets controller, the list functionality had a "secret_type"
argument, but wasn't being used in the actual query to the secrets repo.
This fixes the issue and adds functional tests to ensure the filter
queries are working correctly.

Change-Id: Ifa42f5e817908973dd8b927e4744cdc754a4b027

commit_message:
Pass secret_type to repository query

In the secrets controller, the list functionality had a "secret_type"
argument, but wasn't being used in the actual query to the secrets repo.
This fixes the issue and adds functional tests to ensure the filter
queries are working correctly.

Change-Id: Ifa42f5e817908973dd8b927e4744cdc754a4b027

commit_message:
Allow for oslo.concurrency 2.3.0

Currently, stable/liberty has a minimum version constraint on
oslo.concurrency of 2.3.0. The code needed in oslo.concurrency to avoid
CVE-2015-5162 is only present in 2.6.1 and newer versions. This hack is
shamelessly stolen from Nova (I135b5242af1bfdcb0ea09a6fcda21fc03a6fbe7d)
to avoid breaking operators who chose to deploy with the minimum allowed
version of oslo.concurrency.

Change-Id: Iff51c59041e23fa158f7939891c46e9a150883fc
(cherry picked from commit e3ac9c61d038e38f63a6136e0b89111b0de9d776)

commit_message:
Deprecate the generic client

The generic client has been around and unused for a really long time. I
dont think it works at all and was never updated to support V3 concepts.
Realistically we can probably just remove it and noone will notice, but
give it a quick deprecation cycle.

Closes-Bug: #1647930
Change-Id: Ie68c8995275bcd55aede49d8f4af4e0d172de089

Depends-On: Ia08c15914d9dbfc3f5dc04ca69a7be26efb6fe64

commit_message:
Always use constraints

This flips the tox.ini to always use constraints installation for all
targets. It drops the extra -constraints targets in the process. This
makes it so there is no developer change required to operate in our new
world order.

Note that coverage and release-notes jobs cannot use constraints yet to
limitations of the tools we use. So, they continue to use the normal
non-constraint install.

Conflicts:
        tox.ini

Change-Id: I218f16c585b7b8a9ea73c6cf1c5b0aef2dcde015
Depends-On: Ia08c15914d9dbfc3f5dc04ca69a7be26efb6fe64
(cherry picked from commit 00a01d012c1f9dce7ed66fdd8027b58d0035c7d7)

commit_message:
Xenialify the grenade forward jobs

This transitions grenade forward jobs to run on Xenial for changes
against newton or master/ocata. The trusty vs xenial upgrade mapping is
the same as with normal grenade jobs except that we start this job on
the "previous" match so the branch we match against in zuul is
different.

Change-Id: Ia2cc1dbb212cfea7b6923384c676d0f6fa91dea0

commit_message:
Pass oslo.messaging kwargs only for "messaging://"

We need to pass oslo.messaging related arguments to
notifier.create() only if the connection string starts
with "messaging". Therefore removing those kwargs for
other connection strings.

Change-Id: Icb168ce6a456e5355aabbaf1283c30d3900a6ceb

commit_message:
Add defaults for config-dir

If no --config-dir switches are given on the command
line, use default directories to search for config
snippets.
This is similar to the default config-file support
oslo.config already includes. It is useful in environments
where command line arguments can not easily be added, like
mod_wsgi Apache envs.

Change-Id: I4df977911539777d1510e8b579375aca5b5f15f4

subject: Add get_version functionality to liberasurecode lib
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-05 04:56:36.000000000', 'files': ['test/liberasurecode_test.c', 'src/erasurecode.c', 'include/erasurecode/erasurecode.h'], 'message': "Add get_version functionality to liberasurecode lib

Currently, we have liberasurecode version info in the header and pyeclib
is using the info to detect the version. However it's a bit painful
because it requires to rebuild pyeclib c code for you to see the actual
installed version.

This addition for liberasurecode_get_version enables caller to get the
version integer from compiled shared library file (.so) and it will
rescure to re-compiled operation from pyeclib.

Change-Id: I8161ea7da3b069e83c93e11cb41ce12fa60c6f32
"}]
commit_message:
Add get_version functionality to liberasurecode lib

Currently, we have liberasurecode version info in the header and pyeclib
is using the info to detect the version. However it's a bit painful
because it requires to rebuild pyeclib c code for you to see the actual
installed version.

This addition for liberasurecode_get_version enables caller to get the
version integer from compiled shared library file (.so) and it will
rescure to re-compiled operation from pyeclib.

Change-Id: I8161ea7da3b069e83c93e11cb41ce12fa60c6f32

commit_message:
devstack multinode: disable some test cases

There are too many failures to timeout with multinode tempest.
As a result, multinode tempest takes too long more than 2 hours to
fail. disable some test cases to shorten it for now. Once they're fixed,
enable them again.

Change-Id: I92aaf0ccbc70dedcb6eb7b41ff4c72e7a3ba2a61
Related-Bug: #1633242

commit_message:
Get assignments with names honors inheritance flag

When listing role assignments with the ?include_names option,
the inheritance flag was not honored.

This change fixes that behavior and enables the test that was
submitted in the parent patch.

Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samueldmq@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1625230

Change-Id: Ic0d32f3e47ee82015d86cec8b7502a440b66c021

commit_message:
Print domain name in mapping_populate error message

domain_id was not defined at the moment when it was referenced and
it caused UnboundLocalError.

Use domain name instead and test it.

Change-Id: Ib351df0942025451994873e272861afec1b60dea
Closes-Bug: 1645571

subject: Remove RHEL registration envrionment file from list
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-07 21:56:58.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/v1/overcloud_deploy/test_overcloud_deploy.py', 'tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': "Remove RHEL registration envrionment file from list

The RHEL registration environment file doesn't actually get written to,
so we were passing an environment file with empty values that would
override any values passed on the command line. This removes that file
from the returned list of templates, allowing the passed-in values to
take over.

Change-Id: I0c14e279842d6e9c8ed540cb7605965b39a49eca
Closes-Bug: #1648238
"}]
commit_message:
Remove RHEL registration envrionment file from list

The RHEL registration environment file doesn't actually get written to,
so we were passing an environment file with empty values that would
override any values passed on the command line. This removes that file
from the returned list of templates, allowing the passed-in values to
take over.

Change-Id: I0c14e279842d6e9c8ed540cb7605965b39a49eca
Closes-Bug: #1648238

subject: Run docs tags only plublish on Xenial
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 18:21:16.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/openstack-publish-jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Run docs tags only plublish on Xenial

I don't think we can switch on branch name for these release queue jobs
because the ref info will always be fore refs/tags/*. Just move forward
to running this on Xenial since the vast majority of our future releases
that need publishing will have been tested on Xenial.

Change-Id: I855a2242af4644dd86117812a5efab4643a3f771
"}]
commit_message:
Run docs tags only plublish on Xenial

I don't think we can switch on branch name for these release queue jobs
because the ref info will always be fore refs/tags/*. Just move forward
to running this on Xenial since the vast majority of our future releases
that need publishing will have been tested on Xenial.

Change-Id: I855a2242af4644dd86117812a5efab4643a3f771

Run nova next grenade job on xenial

This runs the nova next grenade job on trusty for changes to newton and
on xenial for changes to branches > newton.

subject: Move nodepool integration testing to Xenial
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-08 18:21:16.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Move nodepool integration testing to Xenial

Since devstack and the rest of OpenStack are moving testing for master
ahead to Xenial we should follow along with nodepool integration
testing. This has the drawback of not testing nodepool on the same
distro release we currently deploy on but that seems to be a small risk
compared to deploying an entire cloud on distro it isn't tested on.

Nodepool compared to OpenStack is relatively simple and should be happy
on Trusty or Xenial both.

Change-Id: Id00a069994e9d4443dec483332dbd3787a61fe10
"}]
commit_message:
Move nodepool integration testing to Xenial

Since devstack and the rest of OpenStack are moving testing for master
ahead to Xenial we should follow along with nodepool integration
testing. This has the drawback of not testing nodepool on the same
distro release we currently deploy on but that seems to be a small risk
compared to deploying an entire cloud on distro it isn't tested on.

Nodepool compared to OpenStack is relatively simple and should be happy
on Trusty or Xenial both.

Change-Id: Id00a069994e9d4443dec483332dbd3787a61fe10
